member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.Accounts.ICustomerAccountRestrictionByTender
member.summary:
Restrict specific tenders from contributing to deposits.
Some tenders may not be eligible for contributing into account accumulation. This is usually the case with vouchers and other tender types that were given to the customer in return for points reduction from his account. The equivalent amount of the non eligible tender should be reduced from the items amount used for account accumulation calculation. R10 is optimizing the points accumulation calculation whenever non eligible tenders are in use. The accumulation contribution of each item is calculated, based on the active promotions; the non eligible tender amount is deducted from these items that contributes the least to the accumulation, this maximizing the total amount accumulated in the transaction.

member.summary: /// the non eligible tender id
member.remarks: Payments done with this tender may not contribute to any deposit made into the

member.summary: Customer email verification flow.
member.remarks: Some subscription services, such as mobile and portal services, require email verification. ICustomerEmailVerification follows the steps of email verification: verification request and response.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.EmailVerification.ICustomerEmailVerification.RequestEmailVerfication(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.ICustomer,Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.Loyalty.ISubscription)
member.summary: Initiate the flow of email verification.
member.remarks: Email verification is sent to the customer email that was provided during registration process. R10 generates a unique token and associates it with the customer subscription. The token is embedded in email body.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.EmailVerification.ICustomerEmailVerification.VerifyEmail(System.String)
member.summary: Complete the flow of email verification
member.remarks: When customer clicks the token link in the email verification mail that was sent by 'RequestEmailVerfication', the email is considered verified and the subscription status is changed to active. The customer may not enjoy the benefits of the service (for example, he may be able to login into the portal/mobile application) Throws CustomerNotFoundException

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.Segmentation.ISegment
member.summary:
Represents a customer segmentation.
Segmentation is a marketing strategy that involves dividing a broad target market into subsets of consumers who have common needs. ISegment represents a subsets. Subsets may be divided by criteria such as age and gender, or other distinctions, such as location or income.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.OnlineRedemption.ICustomerAssetUpdateAuthorizer
member.summary: Online redemption authorizer processed online redemption requests whenever an online validation is required.
member.remarks: The retailer may offer his customers various rewards that has limited use, a common example is unique coupons and points redemption. When a customer claims his reward (i.e. pays with points, redeems a unique coupon), the online redemption authorizer ensures that the reward is still valid and was not already used by the customer. The authorization process handles a single request at a time, to ensure no double redemption is allowed. If the redemption request is approved, the quantity of redemption is reduced; hence, if a points redemption request is approved, then the customer's account balance is decreased. Also, if a unique coupon request is authorized, the coupon is marked as used and cannot be used again.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.OnlineRedemption.ICustomerAssetUpdateAuthorizer.Authorize(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.OnlineRedemption.ICustomerAssetUpdateRequest})
member.summary: Authorize a number of redemption requests.
member.remarks: All requests must be authorized. If at least one request fails to get authorized, all of them fail. Upon successful completion, the authorizer returns a unique authorization code for all the requests.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.OnlineRedemption.ICustomerAssetUpdateAuthorizer.AuthorizeRetroactive(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.OnlineRedemption.ICustomerAssetUpdateRequest},Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.ICustomer)
member.summary: when the authorizing source was offline during customer order completion, the retailer may have decided to authorize the redemption requests and accept any potential costs, like over redemption of a customer account balance. The accepted requests are logged in the transaction log and when the communication is back online, the authorizing source gets updated retroactively. Any restrictions that may cause a request to be rejected in an online mode, are accepted in retroactive mode, since this is after the fact. The retroactive authorization may be used to track and handle over redemption scenarios.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.OnlineRedemption.ICustomerAssetUpdateRequest
member.summary: Online redemption request is processed by whenever an online validation is required.
member.remarks: The retailer may offer his customers various rewards that has limited use, a common example is unique coupons and points redemption. When a customer claims his reward (i.e. pays with points, redeems a unique coupon), the online redemption authorizer ensures that the reward is still valid and was not already used by the customer. The authorization process handles a single request at a time, to ensure no double redemption is allowed. If the redemption request is approved, the quantity of redemption is reduced; hence, if a points redemption request is approved, then the customer's account balance is decreased. Also, if a unique coupon request is authorized, the coupon is marked as used and cannot be used again.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.ICustomerTokenDao
member.summary: A unique token (GUID) generator for means of customer sign-up and email verification.
member.remarks: As part of customer signup process, email verification may be required by the retailer. A customer token is generated per each request and used to authenticate the email verification made by the customer. When a token is generated, a record is saved in CDM. This record is deleted when a customer successfully verifies his email, or by a retention policy that handles these records.

member.summary: Get a token record by the customer Id
member.remarks: The customer id represents a customer who has recently signed up or reset his password

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.ICustomerTokenDao.GetTokensCreatedBefore(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Get customer token records that were created before the given date.
member.returns: Returns number of deleted records
member.remarks: When new customers are created in CDM as a result of a sign up to the retailer online services, the retail may wish to request email verification before the customers are considered as valid. If a signed up customer does not validate his email after a period of time (defined by a retention policy), these customer deleted from CDM with their pending token. In an existing customer also signs up to the retailer online service with an email address, and the customer does not validate his email, only the token is deleted but the customer record remains intact in CDM.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.Identification.IDataPatternCredentials
member.summary: A customer can be identified by different credentials, some of which are extension credentials. The IDataPatternCredentials is en extension point that allows the injection of a new kind of customer credentials into the customer identification flow.
member.remarks:
When customer is added by a barcode, the server decodes the barcode into options. These options are given to which should return a valid , or null if the decoded data is unidentified.
Example: The core supports the following customer credentials: - identifying a customer by a loyalty card number - identifying a customer by a customer id in CDM. This may by the case with mobile application which don't necessarily involve loyalty cards.
A colleague card is a common extension points, where a customer needs to be identified by a colleague card, however there is no record in CDM for that customer. The extension should define a data-pattern, identifying the colleague card and implement IDataPatternCredentials for that pattern. The core will load all registered implementations of and will try to get a valid credentials from all of them. The first credentials that produces an by which a valid customer is retrieved, is selected and the respective customer is identified.

member.summary: Get based on a customer.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.Loyalty.ILoyaltyProgram
member.summary: A loyalty program is a service provided by the retailer to subscribed (enrolled) customers. Loyalty program is usually associated with customer accounts, such as E-money or points accounts. During customer subscription process, new accounts are created for the customer. New accounts types may be added to the program at any time, the loyalty program handles the creation of the new account to customers that are already subscribed.

member.summary:
A proof of subscription of a customer to a subscription-service.
The concept of subscription-services is broad and covers any service that the retailer offers to the customer; a common example is a loyalty program. Loyalty program requires customer registration. The process of registration produces a subscription that is associated with the customer.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.Wallet.ICreditCardValidator
member.summary: Validates that a given credit card will be saved if it fits to validation rules in implementing class
member.remarks:
When adding a customer payment mean, certain validation algorithms can be employed. An implementation of this interface is injected, and used in the CustomerPaymentMeanAdd service.
As an extension point, IProviderCreditCardValidator is provided by injection and enables using extended validations.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.Wallet.ICreditCardValidator.ValidateCard(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.Wallet.ICreditCardData)
member.summary: Employs validation algorithm(s) to inspect card data before it is allowed to be saved for a customer.
member.remarks:
Prior to associating the payment mean to a customer in the token server, the PAN and expiration date can be validated by this method.
The default card validator checks the card had not yet expired and the PAN is run through a data pattern decoder to make sure one of the data patterns configured recognizes it as a valid PAN, i.e. decodes it to Tender data.
An exception is expected if the payment mean fails validation.
member.param: Represents a payment mean (card).

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.Wallet.IProviderCreditCardValidator
member.summary: Provides an extension point for additional options to validate new payment means (cards).
member.remarks: Provided to ICreditCardValidator by injection.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.Wallet.IProviderCreditCardValidator.ValidateCard(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.Wallet.ICreditCardData)
member.summary: Provides additional validation in addition to the validation that is already done in ICreditCardValidator.
member.remarks: The default implementation of ICreditCardValidator calls this method when its own ValidateCard method is called. An exception is expected if the payment mean (card) fails validation.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.IAffiliation
member.summary: Any relationship between customers is expressed by an Affiliation. The affiliation is a directed relationship (direction is important), the affiliation says something about a customer and how he is related to other customers (the affiliated customers). The business meaning of the affiliation is defined by the implementation.
member.remarks: Common affiliation examples are:

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Customer.IAffiliation.Customer
member.summary:
The customer that this affiliation defines.
An affiliation is a relationship with direction; the Customer is the origin, that is in a relationship with the affiliated customers. This does not necessarily mean that any of the affiliated customers has the same affiliation with the Customer.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Document.TDM.IDocument
member.summary:
Represents a description of a business activity, that was chosen to be documented and stored for later use.
The scope of a document and the information preserved may differ between various system domains and activity types. For example:
System login:
When a system user performs a login, a new IDocument object is created, containing information such as user name, date/time of the login attempt, and POS ID.
Sale transaction complete:
Upon completion of a sale, its generated IDocument object contains payment terms, purchased items, customer details, etc.
Return transaction complete:
Upon completion of a return transaction, the created IDocument object will contain the return reason, initial purchase date, etc.

remarks.para: At the end of a selling session to a customer, the retail transaction is closed. At that time, the order is completed and paid, and a receipt is generated and given as a proof of purchase to the customer.
In addition, the same retail transaction is documented in ARTS POSLog 6.0 format, together with the formatted receipt, to be stored for later inquiry by various systems.

member.summary: Adaptor used to specify what data to add to printableData XML for use in the receipt engine. Adaptor specifies the type it can extract data from, where to place the data, and the parameters it is able to retrieve. member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.Period.ICurrentBusinessDay.GetDate(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the Date of the current business day.
member.param: The business unit ID (usually a store) we want to get business day for. Must be a valid business unit ID or null. Must be a valid business unit ID is touchPointId is not null
The touchpoint ID we want to get business day for. Must be a valid touchpoint ID or null.
member.returns: NominalDateTime representing Date only (time part is zero)
member.remarks: Business Day scheduling is managed per business unit and Touchpoint. If storeId and touchPointId are not null, the method returns the current business day as defined by the End Of Day scheduling management of the POS. If storeId is not null but touchPointId is null, the method returns the current local date at the business unit (or date of the host if time zone is not defined for this business unit). If both storeId and touchPointId are null, the method returns the current date of the host.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IAuthorizationCode
member.summary: Authorization code that is returned by Stored Value Account Certificate. Only authorized certificates may update the balance of Stored Value Account

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IAuthorizationCode.UniqueCode
member.summary: A unique code that identifies the authority source if the account modification request. The code may embed any business logic that can later be used to trace the back the origin of authority. For example: when a promotion in a customer order deposit points to a store value account in the form of a points reward, the authorization code may be constructed from [TransactionID + PromotionID], this code can be used to trace back the balance deposit to the transaction which caused it. Similarly, when the stored value account is updated manually by a cashier operation, the authorization code may be constructed from [TransactionID + CashierID]. As long as the code is unique, it is valid. The level of information that can be extracted from the code is the implementation's responsibility.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.NoAuthorization
member.summary: Null object when authorization not granted.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccount
member.summary: Stored value accounts manage the balance and dues, either monetary balance like in case of an obligo accounts or points like in case of loyalty club accounts. The stored value account is part of the Finance Domain and is used by the Customer Domain is part of a customer account

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccount.Deposit(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccountCertificate)
member.summary: deposit an amount to the account. The deposit needs to be authorized by a certificate, which produces an authorization code that is used to trace the value deposit to its authorizing source. Example: points deposit certificate that is created by a points reward can use the customer order Id as an authorization code; this code can be used to trace the points earning back to the customer order that generated it. The account balance is not affected until the deposit authorization code is cleared.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccount.Withdraw(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccountCertificate)
member.summary: withdraw an amount from the account. The withdrawal must be authorized by a certificate. The account balance is not affected until the deposit authorization code is cleared.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccount.Reset(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccountCertificate)
member.summary: Reset the account(Revoke all deposits and withdrawals) and deposit amount to the account.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccount.Balance
member.summary: get the customer account balance. The balance may vary based on cleared and un-cleared deposits/withdrawal requests.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccountBalance.TotalAmount
member.summary: Get total amount, including both cleared and un-cleared deposits/withdrawals.

member.summary: Supported operations on the stored value account balance

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.AccountValueTransferType.Deposit
member.summary: Increment account balance

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.AccountValueTransferType.Withdraw
member.summary: Decrement account balance

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.AccountValueTransferType.PointsAdjustment
member.summary: Reset account balance

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccountCertificate
member.summary: An means of authorizing any modification to a stored value account balance. The stored value account requires an authorization code before accepting any request to modify its balance (Deposit, Withdraw, Reset) It is up to the caller to enforce any business logic that should prevent a customer from modifying the account. For example: if the business allows account withdrawals only during working hours, the certificate implementation of Authorize method should enforce that rule and not provide an authorization code. If a certain customer is only allowed to deposit but not allowed to withdraw, the specific implementation of the certificate should enforce that rule. The stored value account is only aware of the balance and responsible for its modification and auditing.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccountCertificate.ReferenceId
member.summary: A unique reference that serves as a proof that the certificate is valid.
member.remarks: The reference is logged in a and can be used to trace back the account transaction to its origin.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccountCertificate.Amount
member.summary: Amount to be authorized for the stored value account

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.StoredValueAccount.IStoredValueAccountCertificate.BusinessDate
member.summary: Date and time of certificate request. This is the date in which the request was issued.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.BusinessRules.Audit.IRestrictionAuditLogData
member.summary: Represents an audit of a triggered restriction, that may occur within a wider context of a conversation between a client and the server. Used by the various restriction mechanisms to ultimately record data about the triggered restrictions to the TLog.
member.remarks: Current restriction mechanisms using the audit type are age restrictions and business rules.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.BusinessRules.Audit.IRestrictionAuditLogData.TransactionId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the associated transactional entity.
member.remarks: Transactional entities, in this context, include IRetailTransaction entities, ICustomerOrder entities, and other cash-office related transactional entities.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.BusinessRules.Audit.IRestrictionAuditLogData.IsSatisfied
member.summary: Gets or sets an indication of whether the current restriction was satisfied (automatically or by input from the user).

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.BusinessRules.Audit.IRestrictionAuditLogData.AuditKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a key that distinguishes this audit data and enables relating and grouping different audits together within the context of a client/server conversation.
member.remarks: Currently used by the IConversationRepository instance to group IRestrictionAuditLogData objects into IConversationAudit objects.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.BusinessRules.Audit.IRestrictionAuditLogData.SequenceNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the sequence number of the line the restriction was applied on. Use to record the IRestrictionAuditLogData on the relevant line in the TLog.

remarks.para: If a restriction isn't associated with any line in a transaction, then sequence number value will be 0. If a restriction was run on several lines, the sequence number of the last one will usually be used.
Also used by the IConversationRepository instance to group IRestrictionAuditLogData audits into IAuditGroup objects.

May be used as part of the key according to which audits are grouped into IAuditGroup objects. This becomes relevant for grouping when a restriction is run on several lines in the same request, e.g., when an intervention is resolved, and restrictions are re-evaluated on all lines.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.BusinessRules.Audit.IRestrictionAuditLogData.RequestId
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique request id for the incoming service call. Use to group by IRestrictionAuditLogData into IAuditGroup

remarks.para: Currently used by the IConversationRepository instance to group IRestrictionAuditLogData audits into IAuditGroup objects.

May be used as part of the key according to which audits are grouped into IAuditGroup objects. This becomes relevant for grouping when a restriction is run multiple times on the same line, which has already been added to the order, or when a restriction is not associated with any line, in which case aggregation of audits into groups is done according to the request identifiers.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.BusinessRules.Audit.IRestrictionAuditLogData.IsAutomatic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the triggered restriction associated with this audit was automatically resolved by the system, without any option for user intervention.
member.remarks: If IsSatisfied is false, an IsAutomatic value of true indicates that the restriction prohibited the triggering action, without any option for the user to approve the activity. If IsSatisfied is true, an IsAutomatic value of true indicates that the restriction was automatically approved by the system.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.BusinessRules.Audit.IRestrictionAuditLogData.ServiceName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the incoming service call.

remarks.para: Currently used by the IConversationRepository instance to group IRestrictionAuditLogData audits into IAuditGroup objects.
May be used as part of the key according to which conversations are grouped into IConversationAudit objects. Whenever the service-name changes, we may assume that a new conversation has begun.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.BusinessRules.Audit.BusinessRuleAuditLog.IsAutomatic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the triggered restriction associated with this audit was automatically resolved by the system, without any option for user intervention.
member.remarks: If IsSatisfied is false, an IsAutomatic value of true indicates that the restriction prohibited the triggering action, without any option for the user to approve the activity. If IsSatisfied is true, an IsAutomatic value of true indicates that the restriction was automatically approved by the system, and therefore the user was never prompted to handle the restriction.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.BusinessRules.Results.IRuleResultManager
member.summary:
Represents a manager that encapsulates the business of how IRuleAction objects should be handled at runtime. Among other things, this business includes the priority of results, i.e., the order and time in which they should be handled.
During normal service execution flow, this class is called after service execution completes, at which point all pending, unhandled IRuleAction objects are handled.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.BusinessRules.Results.IRuleResultsWriter
member.summary: Represents a writer for rule results that have been outputted by triggered business rules during the execution of the current request.
member.remarks: The writer maintains a buffer of pending satisfied results. If no errors occur during the execution of the request, the pending satisfied results are written to the output stream. If a triggered business rule returns a RuleResult that is not satisfied and stops the execution of the current request, the writer will ignore pending satisfied results and write only the unsatisfied RuleResult.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.BusinessRules.IBusinessRule
member.summary:
Represents a business rule - a statement that defines or constrains some aspect of the business. It is intended to control or influence the behavior of the business and describe the operations, definitions and constraints that apply to an organization.
In order to benefit from the full capabilities of the business rules infrastructure, implementors of this interface should derive their rule from Retalix.StoreServices.BusinessComponents.BRMS.BusinessRuleBase.
member.remarks:
A business rule inspects the system state and, if some conditions are met, responds according to defined behavior. The system state relevant to the rule is encapsulated by an object that is passed to the rule when it is evaluated.
Each rule implementation defines the criteria that can be configured for it, according to which its applicability is determined. In addition, a business rule may include one or more ICondition objects that may participate in this evaluation process in order to determine if the rule is applicable.
If a rule determines that it is applicable given the current system state, it returns an IRuleAction object representing the behavior that the rule expects the system to follow. This result may be configured for a rule type when it is defined, or it may be predefined by the rule independent of any external configuration.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.DataPattern.IDataPatternDecoder
member.summary: Recognize decodeable bar codes and handle decoding of barcodes into parts
member.example:
For a given barcode pattern: 1) Recognizer - Length:10, init 999 2) Content: a) Character 4 to 8 represents product code b) Character 9 to 10 represents quantity
And for a given code: 9991234510 Results of pattern will be: product code - 12345 Quantity - 10

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.Service.IUnitOfWorkBeginObserver
member.summary: Implementers of this interface may intervene during the life-cycle of the unit-of-work that encompasses service-execution.
member.remarks: There is no guarantee that a specific implementer of this interface will be called for any of the handled events, nor is there any guarantee of the order in which implementers are called. If an implementer of an event throws an exception, invocation of remaining observers does not continue.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.Service.IUnitOfWorkBeginObserver.OnBegin(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.UnitOfWork.IUnitOfWork)

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.Service.IUnitOfWorkCommittedObserver
member.summary: Implementers of this interface may intervene during the life-cycle of the unit-of-work that encompasses service-execution.
member.remarks: Since this observer is run after the UOW has been committed and therefore failures will not cause a rollback, each observer will run in isolation with a new UOW and any exception thrown by an observer will be caught and logged and the processing will continue. The UOW that the observer is run in will not notify observers to prevent endless recursion.

member.summary: Occurs after the unit-of-work has been committed.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.Events.IDomainEvent

summary.para: Represents a business event that occurred in the system and may be dispatched to handlers. Concrete domain events must derive from this class to be used with the domain events system. Domain events can be dispatched to handlers in the same process using the IDomainEventsDispatcher

Handlers register to interesting events by implementing the IEventHandler<T> interface and registering with the IOC container for this interface. Handlers that implement IEventHandler<T> will be notified when this event type or any derived event type are raised. Specifically handlers that implement IEventHandler<DomainEvent> will be notified for any event type raised.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.Events.IDomainEventsDispatcher

summary.para: Dispatches a domain event that occurred in the system to handlers registered handlers in the same process. The default handler can be obtained through the global environment. You do not normally need to create another dispatcher.

Handlers register to interesting events by implementing the IEventHandler<T> interface and registering with the IOC container for this interface. Handlers that implement IEventHandler<T> will be notified when this event type or any derived event type are raised. Specifically handlers that implement IEventHandler<DomainEvent> will be notified for any event type raised.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.Events.IDomainEventsDispatcher.Dispatch``1(``0)
member.summary: Raises the event, dispatching it all interested handlers that can be reached through the default dispatcher.
member.param: The event to be raised, containing the relevant data about the business situation.

member.summary: Clears callbacks passed to Register on the current thread

member.summary: Registers a callback for the given domain event

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.TextCriterionMatchMode
member.summary: Represents an enumeration for a string search type.
member.remarks:
When a search is invoked, the string to look up for can be determined whether to look it:
Not exact match
Exact match
In the beginning
In the end

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.TextCriterionMatchMode.BestMatch
member.summary: Results should contain in some way the given string, based on search provider.
member.remarks: Actual behavior will be determined by the search engine used. (SQL Like expression, freetext engine, document index engine). For instance, while searching for 'abc', default SQL Server search will result in: ...LIKE '%abc%' expression.

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.TextCriterionMatchMode.Exact
member.summary: Results should exactly match the given string.

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.TextCriterionMatchMode.StartsWith
member.summary: Results should begin with the given string.
member.remarks: Note that search provider might give more results than expected due to word indexing and thesarus usage. For instance, while searching for 'apple', SQL Server CONTAINS search will return both 'Apple pie' and 'red apple'

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.TextCriterionMatchMode.EndsWith
member.summary: Results should end with the given string.
member.remarks: Note that not all search providers supports this mode. For instance, SQL Server CONTAINS does not provide such functionality

members.member:
Represents an identifiable business Component that is containd as part of an Entity. A Component encapsulates data, operations and events, just like an Entity, but is not accessible and manipulated on its own. Unlike plain complex types within an Entity, a Component is replaceble and extensible.
The type of the Id of the Component. The Entity type this component belongs to. /// The type of the Id of the Entity this component belongs to.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.Entity.IComponent`3.Entity
member.summary: A reference to the Entity that contains this Component. When the component is added to an Entity as a property or in a collection, this property must be set to reference the containing Entity. When the component is detached from the Entity, this property must be set to null. See ComponentHelper for reference.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.Entity.IComponent
member.summary: A none generic interface to a component, used to attach and detach it from the containing entity.

member.summary: Represents abstract class for types that represents Id of some type. Contains all implementations relevant for equality.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.Entity.IEntityRegistrationFacility
member.summary: Interface for registring Entities and Components implementation on system initialization. Registered types are accessible at runtime through the IEntityServices interface.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.Entity.IEntity`1
member.summary: Represents an identifiable business entity that encapsulates data, operations and events. An entity is the minimal piece of system data that is manipulated and persisted by itself. Entity data is composed of Primitives, Complex Data Objects and Identifiable Components. An Entity may reference other entities, which are not considered part of the entity data.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.Entity.IIdentifiable`1
member.summary: Represents an object in the system that is identifiable. Identifiable is the base for persistable and maintainable objects in the system.
member.typeparam: Unique identifier of the object. This should be system wide unique for objects of the same type and consistant across databases.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.Entity.IPersistable
member.summary:
Defines the basic properties of a persistable object in the system.
The last time the object was explicitly updated by the application. Data synchronization (UOW "silent mode") is not considered an explicate update, so it should not modify this property.
The object version that is used for optimistic transaction synchronization. This version is updated each time the object is persisted including on Data synchronization (UOW "silent mode")

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.RetentionPolicy.RetentionPolicyExecutionResult
member.summary:
Represents a status of a single execution of a RetentionPolicy. object. When a RetentionPolicy is executed, the execution result can represent several different statuses. Execution of a RetentionPolicy is done by calling .
The status provides the following information provides the following services:
What is the entity type that was processed
In case of failure - what is the exception received from the execution
How many entities were deleted during single run
The status of the policy: the single execution of RetentionPolicy finished to run successfully. the single execution of RetentionPolicy failed with and exception the single execution of RetentionPolicy deleted part of the entities that should be deleted but did not finish to delete all.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.RetentionPolicy.RetentionPolicyExecutionResult.EntityType
member.summary: gets or sets the type of the entity that was processed during the single execution

member.summary: gets or sets the exception - in case of Failed State. If the status if Completed or NotCompleted , the value will be null.

member.summary: gets or sets the count of entity deleted - in case of Completed or NotCompleted State

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Infrastructure.RetentionPolicy.RetentionPolicyExecutionResult.State
member.summary: gets or sets the RetentionPolicyState of the execution

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Organization.TouchPoint.ITouchPoint
member.summary: Represents a managed application that interacts with R10.
member.remarks:
TouchPoint is used in order connect a Touch Point Applications and Devices to the R10 system.
A TouchPoint is identified uniquely within a BusinessUnit.
TouchPoint is an identified endpoint that is authorized in R10 system.
Peripheral devices: Peripheral devices in R10 are managed by the TouchPoints.
Such devices can be: printers, scale or barcode-scanner or Magnetic Stripe Reader(MSR).
TouchPointApplications: Any R10 Client is connected to a specific TouchPoint.
Such clients can be: POS, Self Scan or Shopper Gateway etc.
Identity: Any TouchPoint in R10 has an identity which is authorized to connect to R10 and specify the sets of its Activities.
Status: Any TouchPoint in R10 has a Status which represent the state of its connection.
RetailSegment: Any TouchPoint in R10 has a RetailSegment which can be used for segmentation.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Organization.BusinessUnit.IBusinessUnitRelation
member.summary: Represents the relation between two business units A and B where B is an ancestor of A in the BU tree. The Id member represents A and the RelatedId member represents B. All the relations for a specific Business Unit, A, represent the path from the root of the BU tree to A where each node in the path is represented by the RelatedId property of the relation and all relations have the same Id property, which is A.

member.summary: The depth of the ancestor (sepecified by ) on the BU tree, where the root of the tree has a depth of 1.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Organization.BusinessUnit.IBusinessUnitDao.GetAllRelations
member.summary: Returns all BU relations, which are all child-ancestors relations that could form the entire Business Unit tree.
member.remarks: The result is lightweight since it contains only ID's. For each BU in the tree, all the relations with the same Id as the given BU are the ancestors of the BU. The ancestor's ID is given by the property. The depth of the ancestor in the BU tree is given by the property. (the root level is 1) The given BU itself is also included in the result. As a result, this method returls all paths from the root for all BU's in the system.

members.member: The name of the business unit that should be retrieved. The IBusinessUnit that corresponds to the assigned name

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Organization.BusinessUnit.IBusinessUnit
member.summary: Represents a retail organization or a sub unit in a retail organization.
member.remarks:
A BusinessUnit Represents a place on the organizational hierarchy. This place can be associated with a physical store or of a logical brand or region.
A BusinessUnit is a node in composite structure which forms an hierarchical tree (BusinessUnit hierarchy) of sub Business Units.
Every BusinessUnit (or sub BusinessUnit) can be referenced by other entities so it become correlated with configurations, rules and policies (as culture, prices, selling restrictions).
For example, Retailer which is located over few countries in Europe may define En-UK culture code referencing to UK division and fr-FR culture code referencing to france division. The same retailer can define different selling rules corresponding to the business unit.

code.description: This example shows how to use the IBusinessUnit interfaces.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Organization.BusinessUnit.IBusinessUnit.Id
member.summary:
Gets the unique ID of the BusinessUnit.
This ID is intended to be used as lifetime key of the BusinessUnit for logging or referencing purposes.
member.remarks:
This ID is defined when a new Business Unit is added to the system (usually during the maintenance procedure), It should be populated using the Business Unit Factory
This ID must not be null and can not be changed ever (since it might be referenced).
The purpose of this Id is to enable logging and referencing to a Business Unit basing on a textual key. This is specifically required in order to reference it from external systems. For example: when logging information into the Transaction Log or when implementing an RTI contract.
An example use for Id can be 025

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Organization.BusinessUnit.IBusinessUnit.Name
member.summary:
Gets or sets the unique Name of the BusinessUnit.
This name is intended for lookup and human identification and not for referencing. In order to reference it, please use the Id.
member.remarks:
BusinessUnit is a unique name that must be given the a business unit.
Unlike Id, Name can be changed as long as its uniqueness is kept. This is why it should not be used as a reference.
An example use for Name can be Dallas downtown East

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Organization.RetailSegment.IRetailSegment
member.summary: Represents a specific retail classification within general segmentation method.
member.remarks:
Retail segments are commonly defined in order to extend business rules to have segment based behavior. RetailSegment is a general purpose tag that can be attached to some of the R10 entities in order to classify them as belonging to a segment. This classification is very general and can be used as a criteria for segment based behavior. Following are examples for retail segments: 1) Segmentation method - Checkout; Classificaitons- Main checkout 2) Segmentation method - Checkout; Classificaitons- Pharmacy 3) Segmentation method - Security zone; Classificaitons- High 4) Segmentation method - Security zone; Classificaitons- Med For is example for usage - a specific point of sell (POS) can be associated with a retail segment, and behavior can be applied on all the points of sell that have/or do not have a specific RetailSegment.
Retail segments can also be attached to other entities. For example menu configuration can be assigned to retail segment in order to have different user experience when working on menu for POS touch point defined in Main checkout or pharmacy checkout.
The specific entities that can be tagged using RetailSegment are:
IActivityConfiguration
IBusinessUnit
ICustomerDisplayLayout
IKeyboardConfigurationEnvironment
ReceiptEnvironment
IRole
ITouchPoint

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Organization.RetailSegment.IRetailSegment.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique ID of the segment classification. This ID is intended to be used as lifetime key of the RetailSegment for logging or referencing purposes.
member.remarks:
The ID is used for comparison purposes, i.e, to identify a IRetailSegment by the ID. This ID is defined when a new RetaileSgment is created (usually during the maintenance procedure), It should be populated using the Retail Segment Factory.
This ID must not be null and can not be changed ever (since it might be referenced).
The purpose of this Id is to enable logging and referencing to a RetaileSgment basing on a textual key. This is specifically needed in order to reference it from the outside.
For example: when logging information into the Transaction Log or when implementing an RTI contract or when considering a business rule.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Organization.RetailSegment.IRetailSegment.Name
member.summary: Gets the unique Name of the Retail Segment.
member.remarks:
The purpose of this name is to provide a meaningful name to a segment - its primary purpose is to enable lookup and human identification of the segment rather than computerized identification.
It should be populated using the Retail Segment Factory.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Organization.RetailSegment.IRetailSegment.SegmentationMethod
member.summary: Gets the Segmentation Method.
member.remarks: A Segmentation Method is used as a key for the business rules that are associated with this segment. For example, a Security zone, Checkout zone or Advertisement zone. It should be populated using the Retail Segment Factory.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Price.BeforePriceMaintenanceEvent
member.summary: Represents a price maintenance event that occurred during creating/deleting/updating a Price.
member.remarks:
This event will be dispatched via the Dispatcher when the user will invoke
a new price maintenance action.
For example - when the cashier updates a price in the fuel pos, and a business rule has been configured for this activity that a manage approval is required, then this rule will be invoked as part of this action.
This event needs to be mapped with its concurrent activity - . see code example:

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Price.AfterPriceMaintenanceEvent
member.summary: Represents a price maintenance event that occurred after creating/deleting/updating a Price. The event contains PriceEventDTO with information about the price and the action that performed e.g: add, delete PriceEventDTO.
member.remarks:
This event will be dispatched via the Dispatcher when
a new price maintenance action was done.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Price.PriceApproval.PriceChangeStatus
member.summary: Represents an enumeration for the available price statuses.
member.remarks: An IPriceApprovalRecord in the system holds its status. The price can be pending, approved or rejected. This status determines whether the price is activated or not. For example, Supposed today's date is the 20th to December, 2013. A chocolate has a price for 10$ with status "Approved" and effective date for 20/12/2013. The same chocolate has a price for 5$ with status "Pending" and effective date for 24/12/2013. The lower price's status is "Pending" because the retailer wishes to activate it only on Christmas. Therefore, on the 24th to December the retailer will activate the lower price by setting its status to "Approved".

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Price.PriceApproval.PriceChangeStatus.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new with an existing value.

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Price.PriceApproval.PriceChangeStatus.Pending
member.summary: Indicates that the price status is "pending".
member.remarks: For example, when a new price is added to the system, its status will be set as "Pending".

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Price.PriceApproval.PriceChangeStatus.Approved
member.summary: Indicate that the price is "approved".
member.remarks: For example, when a new price is added to the system, its status will be set as "Pending". Whenever the retailer wishes, he will activate it by setting its status to "approved".

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Price.PriceApproval.PriceChangeStatus.Rejected
member.summary: Indicates that the price is rejected.
member.remarks: For example, when a new price is added to the system with a wrong value and the retailer wished to decline it, then he will de-activate it by setting its status to "Rejected".

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Price.PriceApproval.PriceChangeStatus.Default
member.summary: Indicates the default price change status.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.StoreRange.IStoreRange
member.summary: Represents the store range or list of all the products marked in the catalog as available at a store.

code.description: This example shows how to create store range in the context of a business service.
This example shows how to get all the business units that includes the product in their store range using the data connectivity services.

member.para:
The StoreRange provides the following services:
Adds a product to the store range.
Excludes a product from the store range.
Checks if a product is in the range
Checks if a product was removed from the store range.
Deletes all store range configurations for the specified product.
member.remarks: Selling processes validate the store range when retrieving the relevant products for sale. During a sale, the system checks if a product is in the store range. If not, the product is not allowed to be sold.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.StoreRange.IStoreRange.BusinessUnit

The start date from which the product is included in the store range.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Hierarchy.Department.IDepartment
member.summary: Represent a department which is a specified node in the Merchandize Hierarchy.
member.remarks:
This entity has two main uses in the system:
As a retailer I would like to track after financial performance of per specific nodes in the Merchandize Hierarchy. This tracking occurs on the product's departments in order to retrieve business information regarding any retail activities.
As a retailer I would to be able to sell any item that was added to the customer's cart. In order to achieve this goal a retailer must sell items that were not found in the catalog with respect to a specific Department, as a department-product. For example, if the cashier wishes to sell a milk which doesn't exist in the catalog, in this case the cashier has an option to sell it as a department-product.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Hierarchy.Department.IDepartment.Id

TODO: (YuvalD) this convention for "Tax" (as below) is very fragile - as no one will know how to manage it all the way.
Note that TaxCategory must be a ICustomCategory with Label "Tax".

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Hierarchy.Department.IDepartment.AssociatedProduct
member.summary: Gets the product associated with the department.
member.remarks:
The department holds this "generic" product which represents the department. This purpose of this product is to allow Department-Sell. Department sell is the case when the cashier want to sell a product that does not exist in the catalog. In this case the cashier use the AssociatedProduct to represent this product.
Note that this product is predefined and associated with the same Merchandize Hierarchy node as the Department is. This product is also defined as a product with OpenPrice and the cashier need to price it upon selling. ///

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Hierarchy.ICategory
member.summary: Represents a category in the product classification.
member.remarks:
Products are categorized by two different type of categories:
1. IMerchandiseCategory
2. ICustomCategory
ICategory is provided as a base for those interface so it is possible to perform many operations on those different categories seamlessly.
As such, this interface cannot be implemented directly but only when implementing a IMerchandiseCategory or ICustomCategory.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Hierarchy.ICustomCategory
member.summary: Represents a node in a CustomCategory Hierarchy.
member.remarks: The CustomCategory Hierarchy is a general purpose construct used to correlate products to a CustomCategory Hierarchy. The CustomCategory Hierarchy is constructed as a tree where the position and depth of the nodes in the tree are significant.

example.code:
<code lang="cs" description="This example shows how to add a category to the ICustomCategory Hierarchy.">
            
            public class CustomCategoryService
            {
                public ICustomCategory AddNewCustomCategory(ICustomCategory parent, ICategoryFactory categoryFactory)
                {
                    string id = "Big_Heavy";
                    string level = "";
                    string type = "SizeHierarchy";
            
                    var descriptions = new List<LocalizedDescription>()
                                           {
                                               new LocalizedDescription("en-US", "Heavy products")
                                           };
             
                    ICustomCategory category = categoryFactory.CreateCustomCategory(id, type);
                    category.Descriptions = descriptions;
                    category.SetMasterCategory(parent);
                    return category;
                }
            }

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Hierarchy.IMerchandiseCategory
member.summary: Represents a node in the Retailer's Merchandise Hierarchy.
member.remarks:
Merchandise Hierarchy is a basic construct used to correlate the products to departments.
Merchandise Hierarchy is constructed as a tree where the position and the depth of the nodes in the tree are significant.
See also IDepartment which is an addition to this mapping.
Another constraint related to the Merchandise Hierarchy is that any product must be associated unequally with a specific IMerchandiseCategory.

example.code:
<code lang="cs" description="This example shows how to add a category to the Merchandise Hierarchy.">
             public class MerchandiseCategoryService
             {
                 public IMerchandiseCategory AddNewMerchandiseCategory(IMerchandiseCategory parent, ICategoryFactory categoryFactory)
                 {
                     string id = "root_dairy_milk"; 
                     string level;
                     string type = "Merchandise";
             
                     var descriptions = new List<LocalizedDescription>()
                                            {
                                                new LocalizedDescription("en-us", "Milk")
                                            };
             
                     IMerchandiseCategory category = categoryFactory.CreateMerchandiseCategory(id);
                     category.Descriptions = descriptions;
                     category.SetMasterCategory(parent);
                     return category;
                 }
             }

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Hierarchy.IMerchandiseCategory.MasterCategory
member.summary: Gets the containing IMerchandiseCategory of the current category.
member.remarks: For example, if "Dairy products" is a sub category of "All products", the master category of "Dairy products" will be "All products".

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Hierarchy.IMerchandiseCategory.SetMasterCategory(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Hierarchy.IMerchandiseCategory)
member.summary: Sets the containing category of the current category.
member.remarks: Note that a IMerchandiseCategory must be unique in merchandize hierarchy and the user of this interface is responsible not to violate this requirement.
member.param: Containing category

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Associations.ILinkGroup
member.summary:
Represents a group of IProducts to be made available as LinkAssociations from other products. Each IProduct represents an available linked during the sale of a parent product. For example, a TV which can be sold with three pre defined warranties : Warranty for 1 year, warranty for two years and warranty for 3 years. The association provides the following services:
The category of the linked IProduct - Represents the type of linked association.
In addition, all services from parent interface are included.

para.b: Note: since 10.5.0 and will be discontinued from version 10.5.3. Use interface Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Associations.Links.ILinkGroup instead.

member.summary: This method is used to create a new instance of an IProductGroup
member.param: The unique identifier of the group. The new instance of the IProductGroup will receive the parameter as a value in the Id property.

members.member:
This method is used to create a new instance of an ILinkGroup. ILinkGroup is a private case of IProductGroup to handle products for .
The unique identifier of the . The new instance of the ILinkGroup will receive the id as a value in the Id property. Two values are available: The link category the ILinkGroup will be initiated with. Link group Category may not be null, and although it may be set later, an instance of it must be specified on creation. A new instance of the ILinkGroup.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Lookup.ProductEagerLoadingCriteria
member.summary: Represent DAO hint for loading requested products. Each flag notifies DAO that corresponding data will be required along with default product data. For example, if ProductSearchCriteria result will be used to present Descriptions and Identifiers of product to user, setting these flags will provide a hint to load Descriptions and Identifiers more efficiently, rather then loading them one-by-one afterwards. When no flag is set, DAO is expected to load eagerly only small part of product's related data, thus preserving resources and execution time. Note that not providing the flag will not cause an error, as it is only a suggestion.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Lookup.ProductSearchCriteria
member.summary:
Encapsulates a composite criteria that enables defining complex search filters. When using this criteria the products that returned match all the following sections:
1. A list of DescriptionCriteria. When using this criteria the products that returned will match all the DescriptionCriteria in the list.
2. A list of CodeCriteria. When using this criteria the products returned will match all the codes in the list.
3. A list of HierarchyCriteria. When using this criteria the products returned will match all the hierarchy in the list.
4. A list of DescriptionOrCodeCriteria. When using this criteria the products returned will match all the DescriptionOrCodeCriteria in the list.
5. A list of HierarchyDescriptionCriteria. When using this criteria the products returned will match all the HierarchyDescriptionCriteria in the list.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Lookup.ProductSearchCriteria.EagerLoading
member.summary: Provides an indication for eager loading associated Product data (e.g. Descriptions, ImageNames) When flag is set, DAO will try to load requested data in more efficient way, along with found products.

member.summary: List of criteria to perform OR operation. If provided, only those provided will be calculated.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Lookup.ProductSearchCriteria.SortingCriterias
member.summary: Gets the sorting criteria for the search result. Note: As for 10.5 only one sorting criteria is supported. In case more then one sorting criteria provided, errors will occur.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Lookup.ProductSearchCriteria.PagingCriteria
member.summary: Specifies paging criteria for search result set

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Lookup.CriteriaMatchMode
member.summary: Represents an enumeration for a given criteria's result positioning.
member.remarks:
When a search is invoked, the string to look for can be determined whether to look it:
Anywhere
In the beginning
In the end
Exact match

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Lookup.CriteriaMatchMode.Anywhere
member.summary: Look for the wanted criteria "Anywhere" in the string.
member.remarks: For example, Supposed the system contain products: Milk, Chocolate, Bread and Cola. If a search is invoked with a criteria that holds a value for "co" and CriteriaMatchMode.Anywhere, then the search results will be: Chocolate and Cola.

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Lookup.CriteriaMatchMode.Start
member.summary: Look for the wanted criteria which "Starts" with the given string.
member.remarks: For example, Supposed the system contain products: Milk, Chocolate, Bread and Beer. If a search is invoked with a criteria that holds a value for "B" and CriteriaMatchMode.Start, then the search results will be: Bread and Beer.

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Lookup.CriteriaMatchMode.End
member.summary: Look for the wanted criteria which "Ends" with the given string.
member.remarks: For example, Supposed the system contain products: Tea, Coffee, and Juice. If a search is invoked with a criteria that holds a value for "e" and CriteriaMatchMode.End, then the search results will be: Coffee and Juice.

member.name: F:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Lookup.CriteriaMatchMode.Exact
member.summary: Look for the wanted criteria which matches the "Exact" given string.
member.remarks: For example, Supposed the system contain products: Tea, Coffee, and Juice. If a search is invoked with a criteria that holds a value for "Tea" and CriteriaMatchMode.Exact, then the search results will be: Tea.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Identifier
member.summary: Represents a single general-purpose IProduct identifier.
member.remarks:
Products may have multiple identifiers associated with them.
Identifier is a general-purpose Product identification with the following constrains:
an Identifier (the combination of code and type) must be unique.
an Identifier must not be associated with more then one product.
Besides of those constraints there are no specific ways how a retailer should use the Identifiers, yet, Identifier are widely used in the R10 system in order to associate or in order to find products. For example, Identifiers may represent an enterprise organizational code or code that is used to identify product in one or more business activities done in the organization.
Some cases where Identifier is used:
Product Identifiers, mostly barcodes, may come in different formats such as EAN, UPC, GTIN etc .
the manufacturer may assign an identifier to the product.
Product may be related to specific unique retailer identifier.
The retailer may choose to treat several physical products, with different identifiers, as the same Product.
For instance, a retailer may decide to define a model of a shirt in all its available sizes and colors as a single product, daily newspapers may have a different code per each day of week etc.
Example - Cola may be associated with following identifiers: a) Code: "123" ; Type "RetailerMainID" b) Code: "2595603692153" ; Type "GTIN" c) Code: "3595603692153" ; Type "GTIN"

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Identifier.Code
member.summary: The product's identifier code. For example: Newspaper's identifier's code is 22446563477.
member.remarks: Note that setting this property is nontrivial and the constrains specified for this interface (see above) must be kept by the user of this interface.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Identifier.Type
member.summary: The product's identifier format. For example: EAN, UPC, Manufacturer, etc.
member.remarks: Note that setting this property is nontrivial and the constrains specified for this interface (see above) must be kept by the user of this interface.

member.remarks: Note that using this class is nontrivial and the constrains specified for this interface (see above) must be kept by the user of this interface.
member.param: the code of the Identifier
the type of the Identifier

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.IProduct
member.summary:
Represents goods or services in the retailer's catalog, either for selling, ordering, or any other use.
Product is the reference for associating information published by the manufacturer or service provider regarding any item in the catalog.
Products are usually labeled by one or more external identifiers, e.g. GTIN or EAN (See: http://www.gtin.info/index.html). Products are described by a set of attributes with values, the attributes may be complex or simple, but are usually fixed and not sensitive to the environmental conditions i.e. a can of coke contains the same amount of sugar regardless of the temperature or time at which it is sold.

code.description: This example shows how to retrieve an existing product with code 123 of type EAN in the context of a business service.
This example shows how to update an existing product's identifiers and save it in the context of a business service.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.IProduct.EntityKey
member.summary:
Gets the unique key of the product entity in the system that cannot be change once you create it.
This key is used to identify product uniquely for maintenance purposes, for example, if you have a daily process that import(update) products from external system to your system, this key will be the reference to specific instance like ID\Passport for people.
With this key you can find the product and change his identifiers for example.

remarks.para: Note that in order to identify a product for business purposes (i.e. lookup) use the Identifiers property.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.IProduct.Weight
member.summary: Gets or sets the supplied weight of the product.
member.value: A product's Weight. The default value is - no weight provided.
member.remarks:
A weight could be used for reporting and for calculation of weight reduction, when product is container.
Please note the limitations of Weight that means comparison and calculation of Weight are possible only within a single UnitOfMeasureType

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.IProduct.Descriptions
member.summary: Gets a list of the product descriptions.
member.value: A collection of ProductDescription that contains the product's descriptions, a product can have multiple descriptions for different languages and types

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.IProduct.Identifiers
member.summary:
Gets a list of Identifiers this product identify by.
Identifiers are used to look up product in a system, each identifier is unique in the system. For example, if you have product in the system with too identifiers (123,EAN) and (456,UPC) you can find this product by look up by identifier (123,EAN) or by identifier (456,UPC).

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.IProduct.ImageNames
member.summary: Gets or sets the names of product images in a URL format.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.IProduct.IsNonMerchandise
member.summary:
Note: This property is non stable and could be removed in future versions Gets or sets the flag that indicates that the product is Non-Merchandise product.
Non-Merchandise products include items such as postage stamps, gift certificates, gift cards, and bottle deposits. Non-Merchandise products could be treated differently in total order calculations. (Taxation, Tendering etc.)

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.IProduct.IsManualPercentageEnable
member.summary:
Note: This property is non stable and could be removed in future versions Gets or sets a flag, which indicates if manual entry of tare percentage is allowed.
When True, it is possible to manually enter percentage of product's weight that is actually tare. Tare weight can be reduced from gross product weight to get net product weight. In case that tare weight is relative (e.g. ice weight in frozen fish), manual entry of tare percentage is required.

member.summary: Represents a data access object for IProduct responsible for saving and retrieving products.

remarks.para:
The ProductDao provides the following services:
Gets a product by an entity key.
Gets list of products by a list entity keys.
Gets a product by an Identifier
Adds a product
Gets the number of products that match a certain criteria
Gets the products that match a certain criteria and classification type
Gets the products that match a certain criteria with paging
Adds a list of products

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.IProductFactory.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new product by a specified EntityKey.
member.remarks: The given key is used to identify product uniquely for maintenance purposes. It is important to note that it is up to the retailer (who use this interface) to keep the following constrains: 1. This key must be set during the creation of a product entity and it cannot be changed during the lifetime of a product. 2. The uniqueness of this key is in the responsibility of the retailer who set it and there are no generation and validation methods that are built in the R10 core to support this.
member.param: The product ID.
member.returns: the corresponding IProduct

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Weight
member.summary: Represents a composite weight value.
member.remarks: A weight in R10 is represented by a value and a that represent the unitOfMeasure. Using this representation it is possible to specify different weight scales such as "gr", "kg" or "kilogram" and compare or calculate composite scales. Yet, as the specific unitOfMeasure are not specified yet, there is no way to make conversions between different unitOfMeasure(s).

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Weight.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the weight value. For example : If weight is 10.33Kg then the weight's value equals to 10.33.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Product.Weight.UnitOfMeasureType
member.summary: Gets or set the Unit of measure type. For example: If weight is 10.33Kg then the weight's unit of measure is Kilogram.
member.remarks: Each item has its own weight, if the item is sold in units, then its weight's unit of measure type equals to EA (Each), and its value will be set to the number of sold units.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.PromotionService.PromotionResources.IPromotionContinuityResource
member.summary: A continuity tracking of the resources that are required by a specific condition of a promotion
member.remarks: When a condition is marked with 'over multiple tickets' indication, is means that the condition's threshold can be met by resources that are acquired over multiple orders; e.g: products purchased over multiple customer orders. Until the condition threshold is met, it is required to keep track of the purchased resources, so when the following order is evaluated, all the purchase history of resources is accounted for. The promotion continuity resource functions as a promotion resource pool, containing only the historic resources relevant to the specific continuity condition. If the less common scenario, when a single promotion has multiple continuity conditions, each condition will have a corresponding IPromotionContinuityResource with its own resource pool.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.Coupons.ICoupon
member.summary: A coupon instance is a refinement of a coupon series. The coupon instance unique identifiers are the 'Series ID' and 'Offer ID'. The coupon instance unique identifier is defined as the promotion's condition\reward, which allows the promotion engine to identify which promotion is triggered when this coupon is scanned, or as a promotion's reward. Multi coupon instances are linked to a single coupon series and their properties are inherited from the series properties. However, some properties can be overridden by the instance properties, for example, printing message, tender ID in case of a fallback scenario etc.).

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.Coupons.ICouponInstance
member.summary: A coupon is a full barcode which is linked to a coupon instance. Its unique identifier is considered its full barcode. A coupon has its own validity period, reward value, and an indication whether it is active or blocked. When a coupon is scanned at the POS, if it exists in the data repository, then the reward and other parameters are retrieved. If the coupon does not exist in the data repository, then the reward and other parameters are taken from the coupon barcode\promotion definition.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.Coupons.ICouponSeries
member.summary: A coupon series is a range of coupons that are based on the defined attributes, which can be controlled centrally. Each series can be set up with specific attributes, which determine how the system handles the coupon when identified at the touch point. Each coupon series can be comprised of a number of coupon instances. Each instance inherits the specific coupon series' defined attributes, however it may override them with its own set of attributes.
member.remarks: See also : ICoupon and ICouponInstance

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.Instructions.IExternalPromotionInstruction
member.summary: External Promotion Instruction The promotion engine will add the External Promotion by any External Promotion Instruction detected in the customer order.
member.remarks: A common use case is the creation of specific promotions 'on the fly', by communicating with external system that defines targeted promotion for customers. an extension is able to create the targeted promotion and adding it to the current customer order for evaluation, without any need of having a promotion setup pre-configured in the database.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.IAuthorization.Authorize(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.IReward})

members.member:
Represents a condition to allow capturing the ICustomerOrder elements that met the condition.
The ICondition allows defining Boolean conditions that only check IsMet. In some cases, it is also important to capture the ICustomerOrder elements which meet the condition. This is a common practice when implementing purchase conditions, when it is required to capture the purchased items that meet the condition, and may therefore be rewarded by a IRewardFunction
The model tries to keep the concept of conditions as flexible as possible, thus not only anything expressed in a customer order can used as a condition, such as product lines, coupons, payment terms, day of week, date and time, customer, etc.; also external data that can be accessed during promotion evaluation, such as customer's foursquare check-ins, item's central inventory status, central random number generator, etc can be used. Since the concept of conditions is so broad, we have introduced the concept of capturing 'matched entity'. Matched entity is anything that can be matched to fulfill a condition. The analogy of a pattern that needs to be matched can help understand the relationship between conditions and matched elements. When the pattern of matched elements is found in a customer order, a match is found.
A condition is a building block that is used to express very complex patterns, for example, in the promotion: "Buy a soft drink and a sandwich from a variety and pay only 3; every Monday to Friday between 10:00 to 13:00 (for all customers except store employees)". This promotion's requirements can be expressed by the following conditions: Buy 1 soft drink from a variety Buy 1 sandwich from a variety Day is between Monday and Friday Time is between 10:00 and 13:00 Customer is not an employee
The above 5 conditions, when the logical AND operator is applied, express the promotion business requirement. Using the above conditions, the following matched elements are identified: product lines, transaction date (day of week), transaction time, customer segmentation. >

member.summary: Gets the number of times, a condition was met.
member.returns: The number of times a condition was satisfied.

member.returns: a collection of IMatchedElement

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.ICapture.IsRequiredOnce
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating if the condition is required to be met one time only per ICustomerOrder
member.remarks: Sometimes a condition is valid after it was applied once. For example, in the promotion, buy a computer and get 10% off any software. Only one computer is required to be purchased to receive the rewards on each related purchased software.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.ICondition
member.summary: Represents the condition for the qualifying promotion.
member.remarks:
This interface is used to evaluate a given customer order and verify that the condition is met.
See also ICapture for a more complex condition, that not only returns a Boolean value indicating if the condition is met, but can also capture the customer order matching elements that where captured.

member.summary: Gets or sets the condition's unique ID.
member.remarks: Name should be unique within the set of conditions that are associated with the promotion ...

member.summary: Returns True when condition is met for the given ICustomerOrder.
member.remarks: Consider the given customer order to see if there is a specific match case.
member.returns: true if met, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.ICondition.TryMet(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder,System.Decimal)
member.summary: try to met the condition if not successive ConditionNotMetExecption will be thrown
member.param: number of match

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.ICondition.Criteria
member.summary: Sets or Gets the criteria as a collection of IPromotionCriterion for the defined condition.
member.remarks: IPromotionCriterion is used to specify the relevancy of the condition so only the relevant Conditions will be considered. Using Criterions can both, optimize to matching process and increase the usability of the available Conditions. For example, if the same condition can be offered for different products by attaching the proper Criteria.
