member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.IReward
member.summary: Represents an immediate or deferred benefit that is applied against a Customer Order.
member.remarks: A reward is an immediate or deferred benefit that is applied against a customer order. It is an essential part of the promotion that expresses what happens when all promotion conditions are met". The reward is returned by a reward function for a given promotion match. Retalix 10 comes with common rewards out of the box (such as price modifiers, account balance modifiers, coupons,etc) but there are no limits as to what can applied as a reward, as this is developed by extensions.

member.summary: Represents the reward strategy that defines the logic of selecting rewards for a list of promotions. An example of rewarding strategies may be: 'No double dip of product lines', 'No conflict between promotions', 'one reward from a list of promotions', 'top n rewards from a list of promotions'. member.summary: Represents an IOrderLine in the ICustomerOrder that was captured by one of the promotion conditions.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.Match.MatchedPaymentTerm.MatchedOrderLines
member.summary: The matched order unit lines that are paid by the matched tender.
member.remarks:
When a payment term is captured for a certain amount, it is also recommended to correlate the order unit lines for the respective amount. The order unit lines are the lines affected by any discount that may be given on the amount of the captured tender. For example, spend more than $50 with Visa and get 10% off the amount paid with Visa. The 10% is actually reduced from order unit lines.
The corresponding captured order unit lines take into account any excluded criteria. For example, spend more than $50 in the store (excluding the electronic department) and get %5 off the paid amount. In that case, the captured order unit lines will not include items from the electronic department, not effecting the net price.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.IMatchedElement
member.summary: Represents the IMatchedElement interface which is used to place the actual matched elements from the customer order.
member.remarks: These elements are usually the order lines in the customer order, but can also be any type of element besides the items (e.g.the current date, time, etc).

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.IMatchedElement.Name
member.summary: Matched element name

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.IMatchedElement.Source
member.summary: Gets and sets the actual element that is matched.
member.returns: an unknown type reference to the matched element
member.remarks: The source is usually an object that is in the ICustomerOrder. This type of specified object is unknown at this level, and an issue the user must resolve. Resolving these issues are usually performed using the MatchedElement<T> which is a generic version of this interface.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Promotion.IMatchedElement.Value
member.summary: Gets and sets a decimal value that is set by the Condition, which is evaluated by() and transferred to the Rewarding calculations.
member.returns: a decimal value that represents the matching value assigned during the evaluation
member.remarks: MatchingValue is an easy way to pass information from the condition evaluation process to the Rewarding calculation. This is often required in order to coordinate the evaluation and the rewarding processes. For example: "Spend 10$" and create a customer order of one product with a price of 25$. In this case the condition is matched twice. Therefore, the condition will return an IMatch of two IMatches and both refer to the same product, and each has the MatchedValue = 10$.

members.member:
An instruction to promotion engine.
Promotion instructions are used to affect promotion calculation in cases where the engine is lacking some information. Common examples are: Manual promotion instruction - the cashier requests to activate a manual promotion, providing promotion id and reward amount. Customer promotion approval - some promotions require customer approval; this is a common practice when the promotion redeem points from a member account.
The promotion instructions are associated with a customer order. The promotion engine acts upon all instructions contained in CustomerOrder.PromotionInstructions Promotion instructions may be used by extensions to inject additional promotions to the promotion engine. >

member.summary: Represents a business rule behavior that is triggered when the user recalls a transaction.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.BusinessRules.Rules.IRecallTransactionRestrictionBehavior.MaxHoursSinceSuspend
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time duration, in hours, since the the transaction has been suspended.
member.remarks: Null indicates that this property will be ignored and only will be checked. Otherwise if the transaction is recalled a number of hours equal to or more than this value and is satisfied or not applicable, the rule will be triggered. If is false, this value cannot be null.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.BusinessRules.Rules.IRecallTransactionRestrictionBehavior.IsRecallLimitedForSameBusinessDay
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if recalling of a transaction is allowed only in the current business day. True indicates that a transaction can be recalled on the same business day as it was suspended. False indicates that recall is limited by the (and not necessarily to the same business day).

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.BusinessRules.Rules.ISuspendTransactionRestrictionBehavior.ContainsAuthorizedOnlineItem
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the behavior should be triggered when the transaction contains an authorized online item.
member.remarks: True indicates that the behavior will be triggered when an authorized online item exists in the transaction. False indicates that the behavior will be triggered only when no authorized online items exist in the transaction. Null indicates that the behavior will be triggered regardless of whether or not an authorized online item exists in the transaction.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ConditionalRestriction.IAgeAspectAcceptabilityOverrideStrategy
member.summary: Represents a strategy that can change the core decision of an age-restriction aspect, that the user-input that it received is acceptable and therefore no prompt needs to be displayed in the client in order to gather additional information.

members.member:
Implementors should return true if is acceptable, i.e., contains enough information in order to automatically approve or reject the client's request. Returning false indicates that a prompt should be displayed on the client in order to gather further information.
The aspect that has determined that the current input is acceptable, whose decision this strategy may override.
The current RestrictionContext.
The input that was received from the client, if any, in response to a previous prompt that required input (in response to a RestrictionRuleMissingInputException).

member.remarks: Inputs received over the scope of the transaction are saved per aspect, rather than per rule. member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.Line.IProductLocatorStrategy
member.summary:
Represents an service which has the ability to find product by its code.
R10 Core implements this service as follows:
Supports find item when the product code with leading zero (for example: we can find product with id "123" by give id "00123").
Supports find item when the product code is UPCA (for example: we can find product with id "099999000092" by give id "999999").
Supports find item when the product code is Barcode.
Supports find item when the product code is empty.
Override this interface to change the way the system is looking for product during sale and return.

member.summary: Finds the products by its code.
member.param: The product code.
member.returns: List of found identifier/product pairs.

member.summary:
Represents an service which has the ability to find product by its Identifier.
R10 Core implements this service as follows:
Supports find item when the Identifier code with leading zero (for example: we can find product with id "123" by give id "00123").
Supports find item when the Identifier code is UPCA (for example: we can find product with id "099999000092" by give id "999999").

Supports find Department when the Identifier code is Department id

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.Line.AdditionalInfoContainer
member.summary: Encapsulates additional information that should be passed on the basic information passed into the transaction actions.

remarks.para: Does not contain null values. If the null value is attempted to be set, the appropriate value will be removed from the container.

Safe from overriding property from different owner. For exmaple: two different owners decided to save the same property, but of course each of them put different value, the AdditionalInfoContainer garanties that each of the owners will get the correct value.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.Line.IOrderLine.InitialUnitPrice
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial money value for each, product in this line.
member.remarks:
This value is set when the line is created and remains intact through the line lifecycle.
In most cases this will be equal to the RegularUnitPrice.
In the event of anopen price, price verification, department sale, the price will reflect the initial price set by the user.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.Line.IOrderLine.InitialPrice

This value is set when the line is created and remains intact through the line lifecycle.
In most cases this will be equal to the RegularUnitPrice.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.Line.IOrderUnitLine
member.summary: Represents a single unit in an .
member.remarks:
Unit represents a quantity value of 1 ordered product.
It allows the user to iterate and modify price for each separate unit.
property can be used to get all the additional data that is needed.
When the parent OrderLine Quantity of the UnitsOfMeasure == Each, there will be Quantity.Value unit lines.
For all other units of measure one line will always be present.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.PaymentTerms.IPaymentTerm.Amount
member.summary: Gets an ExchangeMoney object representing the amount of this payment term in both the paid and local currency.
member.remarks: If the payment is in a foreign currency, the BaseAmount will be the amount in the foreign currency, while the ConvertedAmount will be the amount in the local currency after conversion. If the payment is in the local currency, both amounts will have the same value.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.PaymentTerms.IPaymentTerm.NetAmount
member.summary: The actual purchasing power of the amount specified in the PaymentInfo.Amount. It could be that due to tender promotions, a payment request of $x can actually cover goods in a value of $y, where Y > X. In this case the paymentInfo amount will be X and the PaymentTerm amount will be Y. (This can be only on a closing tender, not closing tenders will always show the same amount in the paymetnInfo and the PaymetTerm)

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.PriceModifiers.PriceModifierAction
member.summary: Represents the method used to determine the modifying method of the product price.
member.example:
The New price is set, regardless of the original price of the product.
PriceModifierInfo.Action = PriceModifierAction.Price IOrderLine.RegularUnitPrice = 10
PriceModifierInfo.Amount = 2
Result:
IOrderUnitLine.ModifiedAmount = 2
The price will change by the amount set.
PriceModifierInfo.Action = PriceModifierAction.Amount IOrderLine.RegularUnitPrice = 10
PriceModifierInfo.Amount = 2
Result:
IOrderUnitLine.ModifiedAmount = 8
The price will change by the percentage set.
PriceModifierInfo.Action = PriceModifierAction.Percantage IOrderLine.RegularUnitPrice = 10
PriceModifierInfo.Percent = 2
Result:
IOrderUnitLine.ModifiedAmount = 9.8

The units from the TLog of the original purchase order that have been chosen to be returned and according to which the return order lines will be created.
member.returns:
A sequence of IReturnOrderLine objects, based on the data in , and matching the quantities and prices reflected in .
Created return order lines do not necessarily reflect the structure of the provided . Lines may be grouped and separated according to various criteria, e.g., the parent log lines of the provided unit lines and the prices of the units being returned.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder
member.summary: Represents the intention to purchase products, which can be initiated from many different touchpoints (POS, Mobile Shopper, Self Scan, etc.). A customer order is composed of the customer details, a list of products, payment terms and the details of the context in which it was created (e.g. Business unit, Touchpoint).

code.description: This example shows how to create a customer order in the context of a business service.
This example shows how to retrieve an existing customer order in the context of a business service.

remarks.para: A Customer order is defined as the statement of the intention to purchase products for an agreed price and payment terms, and subsequent activities based on that intent, until full payment is made and the accountability for the goods is transferred to the customer.

Orders are created from one of the touch points by a customer that may or may not be a loyalty member. Orders include sales orders or services. If the customer is not a loyalty member, then an anonymous identifier is assigned and used in place of the loyalty members ID. When a process occurs such as a product void, adding a loyalty member, etc., the system creates an event that can be used by third party systems. For example, when a product is added to an order, an indication is sent to the inventory management system.

para.b: Suppported Operations:

item.description: Add Adds a specific product of specific quantity to the order.

Set Payment Terms Associate specific terms with the order. This will affect pricing. For example: the customer orders a sofa with the intention of paying with a credit card payment. This will create a customer order with one line and payment terms.

para.b: Common Tasks:

item.description: In order to create a Customer order use ICustomerOrderFactory.
In order to get an existing Customer order use [see cref="Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.DataAccess.ICustomerOrderDao"]ICustomerOrderDao[/see].
In order to associate a Customer Order to a Retail Transaction refer to IRetailTransaction.AssociateCustomerOrder.

member.name: E:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder.CustomerSetting
member.summary: Occurs before associating a [see cref="ICustomerInstance"]ICustomerInstance[/see] to the customer order.

remarks.para: CustomerSetting provides an intervention point in the process of adding a customer to the order, this intervention point can be used, for instance, to interact with external systems, in order to execute additonal operations.

An example for such interaction with external systems is an integration with an external customer loyalty system, in order to retrieve loyalty related data and add it as an extension data to the customer instance.

remarks.para: ProductSold provides an intervention point during the process of adding a product to the order, this intervention point can be used, for instance, to interact with external systems, in order to execute additional operations.
An example for such interaction with external systems is an integration with an inventory system in order to reserve the product for the customer to make sure that it will be available.

remarks.para: ProductSold provides an intervention point during the process of adding a product to the order, this intervention point can be used, for instance, to interact with external systems, in order to execute additional operations.
An example for such interaction with external systems is an integration with an inventory system in order to reserve the product for the customer to make sure that it will be available.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder.Sell(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.Line.ProductSaleInfo,Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.InputParametersInfo)
member.summary: Adds products to the customer order, which can be weight items, quantity, etc. The flow of adding a product to the customer order includes the enforcement of various selling restrictions, which are implemented using [see cref="ISellingRestriction"]ISellingRestriction[/see]. After adding a product to the customer order there is an intervention point, which is available by registering to the event. ProductSold.
member.remarks: The action of adding a product to the order affects the value of the BalanceDue.
member.param: A ProductSaleInfo that contains the details of a single product (price, quantity, linked products, etc.).
Contains a description of the entered data in POS.

members.member:
Returns a product that was purchased in a previous transaction. The current customer order may be linked to that previous transaction as part of its creation.
As a result, a respective IReturnOrderLine object is added to the ReturnOrderLines property.
The product to be returned. [exception cref="DenyReturnedItemException"]Product cannot be returned.[/exception]
Some predefined required input is not specified in .
[exception cref="ManagerApprovalRequiredException"] Manager approval is required in order to satisfy the return policy. [/exception]
Return policy for the current customer order was not found.
The quantity specified in is greater than the quantity of that product left for return in the original transaction.
The units specified in are greater than units of that product left for return in the original transaction.

Returns all the products purchased in a previous transaction. The current customer order must be linked to that previous transaction, and the required data should be specified in IReturnCustomerOrderInfo as part of the current customer order's creation, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
As a result, respective IReturnOrderLine objects are added into the ReturnOrderLines property.
[exception cref="DenyReturnedItemException"]At least one of the products cannot be returned.[/exception]
Some predefined required input is not specified in the IReturnCustomerOrderInfo.ReturnInputData object that was used to create the current customer order.
[exception cref="ManagerApprovalRequiredException"] Manager approval is required in order to satisfy the return policy. [/exception]
Return policy for the current customer order was not found.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder.ExtraData
member.summary: Gets the extra data for current customer order.
member.remarks:
This collection is persisted using "table per concrete class" mapping strategy http://ayende.com/blog/3941/nhibernate-mapping-inheritance
The benefit is we can map concrete class without creating unnecessary base, but the drawback that nhibernate will create N (per type) SQL statements to load the collection.
CustomerOrderExtraDataAddedEvent<T> and CustomerOrderExtraDataRemovedEvent<T> are raised accordingly.

member.summary: The amount in which one Payment covers a given Term.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerPayment.ICoveringPayment.Payment
member.summary: The payment that covers the term, at least partially.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerPayment.ICoveringPayment.Term
member.summary: The term that is covered, at least partially.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerPayment.ICoveringPayment.Amount
member.summary: The coverage amount. This may be less then the payment amount, and not higher then the Term amount.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerPayment.IPaymentTermsCoverage
member.summary:
Describes the coverage of Payment Terms by Customer Payments in a Retail Transaction. - All Payments made in a Retail Transaction, must cover one or more matching Payment-Terms in its' associated Customer Orders. - Payment will match a Term based on Tender Type and other Tender parameters. Usually the TenderType.Id is the base for the match. - A payment must cover Terms to its' full amount, or else it will be considered as "Surplus". - Term should be covered to its' full requested amount, or it will be considered as "Unfulfilled".
Example: Customer agreed to pay 10$ in Credit and 10$ in cash. He pays 10$ in credit and 5$ in cash. The coverage will be: - One Covering Payment of Credit Tender for 10$. - One Surplus Payment of Cash for 20$. - One Unfulfilled Term of Cash for 10$.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerPayment.IPaymentTermsCoverage.CoveringPayments
member.summary: A list of Payment to Term coverage amount.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerPayment.IPaymentTermsCoverage.SurplusPayments
member.summary: Payments that do not cover the available Terms to its' full amount. Example: Customer agreed to pay 10$ in Credit and 10$ in cash. He actually paid the full 20$ in cash. In this case, this payment will be considered as Surplus, for it amounts to more then was agreed.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerPayment.IPaymentTermsCoverage.UnfulfilledTerms
member.summary: Terms that were not covered to its' fullest by the available Payments. Example: Customer agreed to pay 10$ in Credit and 10$ in cash. He actually paid the full 20$ in cash. In this case, the 10$ Credit Term is considered to be Unfulfilled.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.RetailTransaction.RetailTransactionLog.IUnitLineLog
member.summary: Represents a unit within a parent ISaleLineLog line in a TLog.
member.remarks: An IUnitLineLog instance in runtime may not have an actual xml representation in the associated TLog. In cases where no unit line exists for a sale line in a TLog, the return engine manufactures one with the assumption that all units in the line are equally priced or there is only one unit in the parent line.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.RetailTransaction.RetailTransactionLog.IUnitLineLog.SequenceNumber
member.summary: Gets the sequence number of the unit within ParentLine.
member.remarks: A unit's sequence number is unique within a parent ISaleLineLog line, but may recurr in other units belonging to other lines. If the section in the TLog represented by ParentLine contained a "unitLines" section, then SequenceNumber will represent the sequence numbers documented in that section. If no "unitLines" section exists for this line in the TLog, the returns domain generates sequential numbers for each unit line log (starting at 1).

If, for example, the porsion of weighable item received a discount when it was originally purchased, the PriceAdjusments should be reduced here by the same amount.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IReceiptedReturnStrategy
member.summary: Represents the strategy used for creating IReturnOrderLine objects, given a set of selected units from the purchase TLog, during a transaction based return.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IReceiptedReturnStrategy.GetReturnOrderLines(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.RetailTransaction.RetailTransactionLog.IUnitLineLog},Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IReturnContext)
member.summary: Creates a sequence of IReturnOrderLine objects representing the return lines in their final state, including their adjusted prices, that will be added to the customer order, based on the data in and a set of selected units from the original purchase TLog.
member.remarks: UnitsToReturn represents the units from the TLog of the original purchase order that have been selected to be returned. Selected unit-logs do not need to belong to the same parent ISaleLineLog representation.
member.param: An IReturnContext instance representing returns-related data relevant for the current transaction and product return.
The units from the TLog of the original purchase order that have been chosen to be returned and according to which the return order lines will be created.
member.returns:
A sequence of IReturnOrderLine objects representing the return lines in their final state, including their adjusted prices, that will be added to the customer order, based on the data in , and matching the quantities in .
Created return order lines do not necessarily reflect the structure of the provided . Lines may be grouped and separated according to various criteria, e.g., the parent log lines of the provided unit lines and the prices of the units being returned.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IUnitLineLogPrioritizationStrategy
member.summary: Represents the strategy that prioritizes original purchase IUnitLineLog objects for return.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IUnitLineLogPrioritizationStrategy.Sort(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.RetailTransaction.RetailTransactionLog.IUnitLineLog},Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IReturnPolicy)
member.summary: Arranges according to the definitions of .
member.remarks: Generally, if the return policy is configured as as true, the strategy will order from highest to lowest prices. Otherwise they will be ordered from lowest to highest.
member.param: IUnitLineLog objects from the original purchase transaction log that should be prioritized according to the definitions of .
The IReturnPolicy instance whose definitions may be used to prioritize .
member.returns: ordered according to the given .

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IReturnUnitsPriceVisitor
member.summary: Defines the interface that must be implemented by a business or domain in order to contribute to the calculation of the original purchase price of a unit of a product for the purpose of returning one or more units of that product. Visitor implementers are chained, i.e., the result of one visitor is passed on to the next. Only the final result is incorporated by the return engine

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IReturnUnitsPriceVisitor.AdjustPrices(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IUnitLineLogWithPromotionPriceAdjusment})
member.summary: Modifies the PriceAdjusment of each IUnitLineLogWithPriceAdjusment object so that it reflects price adjustments made when that unit was originally sold.

remarks.para: After execution of all IReturnUnitsPriceVisitor implementations, the returns domain updates all unit line prices by adding the final value of PriceAdjusment to the unit line's Price.
Therefore, in order to apply a reduction to the return price, reduce the price adjustment, and in order to increase the returned price of a unit, increase the price adjustment.
If, for example, the unit received a discount when it was originally purchased, the matching unit's PriceAdjusment should be reduced in this method by the same amount.

member.param: The unit lines representing all units in the original

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IReturnUnitsPriceVisitor.AdjustBulkPrices(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IBulkItemUnitLineLogWithPriceAdjusments})
member.summary: Implementers may provide price adjustment information about unit lines whose unit of measure is not "Each" and therefore represent items sold in bulk (by weight, volume, etc). Price adjustments are incorporated into the final return price by the return engine, as well as into the strategy for selecting the correct unit(s) to return.

member.summary: Gets the IUnitLineLog object whose price can be modified by changing the value of PriceAdjusment.
member.remarks: Within the context of an AdjustPrices invocation, the Price of UnitLine will remain unchanged and reflect the original value read by the return engine from the TLog.

member.summary: Gets or sets the adjustment that should be applied to UnitLine's Price.

remarks.para: Generally, the adjust applied to this unit should reflect price adjustments that were made when this unit was originally sold.
If, for example, the unit received a discount when it was originally purchased, the PriceAdjusment should be reduced here by the same amount.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IPriceCalculationStrategy
member.summary: A strategy for calculating the return price. During the product return process, this strategy will be used to calculate the return price of the product to be retuned to the customer.

code.description: Calculating return price of a product during Transaction Base Return

member.summary: Calculates the return price of a product based on the price which was paid and the quantity to be returned and the quantity which was already returned during the current return transaction. The calculated return price is used to create a single return line of the product.
member.param: The transaction log line in the TLog, documenting the purchase of the product.
The quantity of the product to be returned.
The quantity of the product that was already returned in the current return transaction.
The return transaction's customer order.
member.returns: The return price of the product.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IRetailTransactionFiltersFactory
member.summary: Represents the interface responsible for the creation of ITransactionLogSaleLineFilters used in return logic.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IRetailTransactionFiltersFactory.CreateSpecialTreatmentRequiredLinesFilter(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the ITransactionLogSaleLineFilter that is responsible for filtering the lines that were not returned in the ICustomerOrder's original transaction. These lines are valid for return, but require special treatment (for example: lines which contain prepaid product).
member.remarks: According to current business, the term "special treatment" here refers to online items in a return-all transaction that have not yet been returned or whose was not rejected by the responsible 3rd party provider.
member.param: The containing original transaction.
member.returns: An ITransactionLogSaleLineFilter that can perform the relevant filtering.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IRetailTransactionFiltersFactory.CreateFailedToReturnLinesFilter(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the ITransactionLogSaleLineFilter responsible to filter the lines from the ICustomerOrder's original transaction that failed to be returned in a specified ICustomerOrder.
member.remarks: According to current business, the term "failed" here refers to online items whose return was declined by the responsible 3rd party provider.
member.param: The containing the original transaction.
member.returns: An ITransactionLogSaleLineFilter that can perform the relevant filtering.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IRetailTransactionFiltersFactory.CreateAvailableForReturnLinesFilter(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the ITransactionLogSaleLineFilter responsible to filter the lines from the ICustomerOrder's original transaction that is returned.
member.remarks: In practice this filter filters out lines that cannot be returned, such as voided or return lines.
member.param: The containing original transaction.
member.returns: An ITransactionLogSaleLineFilter that can perform the relevant filtering.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IRetailTransactionFiltersFactory.CreateAutomaticallyReturnableLinesFilter(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder)
member.summary: Creates an instance of a ITransactionLogSaleLineFilter that is responsible for filtering those lines in 's linked original transaction that can be returned automatically (i.e., without user intervention) via a return-all transaction.
member.remarks: In practice this filter filters out lines that cannot be returned, such as voided or return lines, using the business defined by the filter provided by , and afterwards also filters out lines that must be returned manually by a user, such as electronic and online items.
member.param: The containing original transaction.
member.returns: An ITransactionLogSaleLineFilter that can perform the relevant filtering.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Returns.IReturnPolicy.IsBestForGuest
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating in what order original purchase IUnitLineLog objects are chosen when a product is returned in a receipted return scenario.
member.remarks: By default, when true, original purchase IUnitLineLog objects are chosen according to the highest-valued Price, in order to maximize the customer's return value. By default, when false, the order is reversed and the customer will get the lowest-valued Price first. In practice, the final decision about which original IUnitLineLog objects to choose for a return is done by the registered IUnitLineLogPrioritizationStrategy instance.

The new value for the policy's end date time, or null to remove the policy's end date time, indicating that it will remain effective until replaced. The implementation should intercepts a dispatched event, locate the relevant order lines and dipatch the events to selling behaviours on these lines. The implementation must be registered in IOC for this interfac with the concrete event type.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Behavior.OnlineProduct.IOnlineProductSellingBehavior.BusinessUnits
member.summary:
This collection represents the BusinessUnits which the OnlineProductSellingBehavior applies for.
For example: The OnlineProductSellingBehavior configured for business units "Brooklyn"
Means, that this OnlineProductSellingBehavior won't be recognized at business unit "New-Jersey".
The OnlineProductSellingBehavior are inherited, means that if none is configured on the wanted business unit it will inherit it from its Parent

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Behavior.OnlineProduct.IOnlineProductSellingBehavior.RetailSegments
member.summary:
This collection represents the RetailSegments which the OnlineProductSellingBehavior applies for.
For example: The OnlineProductSellingBehavior configured for retail segment "Self CheckOut".
Means, that this OnlineProductSellingBehavior won't be recognized at retail segment of "Fuel Pos". The OnlineProductSellingBehavior can be inherited, means that if none is configured on the wanted retail segment it can get it (if configured) on all of the retail segments.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.Drawer.IOpenDrawerSpecification
member.summary:
Interface for defining specification that maintain whether to open the till's drawer upon specific conditions during retail transaction.
If one of the implementations returns true on execution the till drawer will open.
member.remarks:
The specification pattern defined by Eric Evans and Martin Fowler.
See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Specification_pattern.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IFSAPaymentRestriction
member.summary:
The IFSAPaymentRestriction represents the Payment Restriction of an FSA Card. The FSA Card is issued in the United States to allow for "tax favored spending accounts". The IFSAPaymentRestriction captures the restrictions on products that can be paid for using the FSA cards. The products are divided into sub categories. These sub categories may be: Rx, Non-Rx, Vision, Dental, or other. These sub categories have a priority between them and Eligibility of products must be satisfied based on this priority.
The IFSAPaymentRestriction should be deployed as a regional extension only in the US.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IFSAPaymentRestriction.EligibilityProfile
member.summary: Each instance of the IFSAPaymentRestriction defines the permitted products permitted for the related Tenders, divided into sub categories. This set of sub categories is a Profile of a Payment Restriction. The EligibilityProfile specified the relevant Profile this instance of IFSAPaymentRestriction should use.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IFSAPaymentRestriction.GetPrioritrizedGroupNames
member.summary: The prioritrized group names under the EligibiltyProfile of the current instance of the IFSPaymentRestriction

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IProductPaymentRestriction
member.summary: The IProductPaymentRestriction represents a the validity of using a particular Payment Method (Tender or Payment Card), to pay for specific products in the CustomerOrder.
member.remarks:
The IProductPaymentRestriction is used during the selling interaction. It captures the metadata of a single Payment Restriction. The instances are persisted in the database and are retrieved during selling processing. The retrieved instances are used in order to determine the lines that are eligible for payment by a particular Payment Method.
The IProductPaymentRestriction is defined per combinations of BusinessUnit, RetailSegment and TenderType. Each such combination is captured in an instance. For a RetailTransaction and CustomerOrder that happen at a particular BusinessUnit and RetailSegment, of all the IProductPaymentRestriction instances defined for the same ITenderType, the one defined for the BusinessUnit closest to the BusinessUnit of the CustomerOrder takes precedence over all others.
This entity is maintained by the ProductPaymentRestrictionMaintenanceService.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IProductPaymentRestriction.Name
member.summary: The name of the ProductPaymentRestriction. This name is used for display purposes and also functions as the key for the particular instance in the database.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IProductPaymentRestriction.EligibilityEnvironments
member.summary: Captures the set of s this Product Payment Restriction is valid for.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IProductPaymentRestriction.TenderBalanceDisplayMode
member.summary: Indicates at which cases the result of the Eligibility Calculation based on this Restriction should be displayed on the client. The validity of the Payments based on the IProductPaymentRestriction is always enforced. However, the remaining eligibility amount is calculated, and reported with the CustomerOrder state, only when it is needed.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IProductPaymentRestriction.ReturnItemsReduceEligibility
member.summary: Determines whether return products should be considered in the eligibility calculation.
member.remarks: When this flag is set to True, the value of Returned Products will reduce the Eligible Amount of the Tenders covered by this IProductPaymentRestriction. Otherwise, the value of the Returned Products will only reduce the Balance Due.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IProductPaymentRestriction.GetEligibleLines(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the Order Lines that the specified tenderId is Eligible for. If the IProductPaymentRestriction implements a priority between the covered Order Lines, each of the prioritized groups contained in the result will have a Name. However, if IProductPaymentRestriction does not implement a priority, all the covered lines will be in one Group, and the Group's name is the empty string.
member.param: The Customer Order to calculate Eligibility of the specified Tender over its Order Lines.
The id of the Tender Type to calculate Eligibility for. If the tenderId that is passed in is null, the calculation will be carried out for all Tenders in the EligibilityEnvironments
member.returns: An instance of . This instance represents a prioritized list of Groups of Order Lines that the specified Tender is Eligible for. Each such Group has a Name and a set of Order Lines.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IRestrictedCardPaymentRestriction
member.summary: The IRestrictedCardPaymentRestriction captures Payment Restrictions based on categories stored on the Payment Card itself. The categories stored on the Payment Card are defined by the card issuer. The IRestrictedCardPaymentRestriction implementation is responsible for the mapping of the categories stored on the Payment Card to products in the current retailer's system. The IRestrictedCardPaymentRestriction determines the Payment Card Eligibility based on the categories stored on the card and the mapping to products configured in the system.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IRestrictedCardPaymentRestriction.GetCustomerOrderProductCategories(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the mapping of the IProduct entities in the to the ICategory entities they belong to, within the context of ParentRestrictionCategory.
member.param: The ICustomerOrder instance that contains the relevant products.

The name of the ICategory entity, in the "RestrictedCard" custom category hierarchy, to use for looking up the product-to-category relationships, or null to use .
Send when calling this method on a non-persisted IRestrictedCardPaymentRestriction instance, for which is null.
member.exception: Thrown when is passed on a persisted IRestrictedCardPaymentRestriction instance that has a configured ParentRestrictionCategory.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IRestrictedCardPaymentRestriction.GetProductsCoveredByCategoryNames(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.CustomerOrder.ICustomerOrder,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Returns the list of the IProduct entities that are eligible for coverage by by the specified . This method is used by client, in case the PaymentRestriction rule is violated, to determine eligible products.
member.param: The ICustomerOrder entity to retrieve products eligible to the specified

The list of categoryNames the Payment Card is eligible for. The category names are as defined by the card issuer. In order to know which products belong to these categories we must use the mappings that is specific to the Payment Card.
member.returns: The list of IProduct objects eligible for coverage by the specified categoryNames, within the context of this ParentRestrictionCategory.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ProductPaymentRestriction.IRestrictedCardPaymentRestriction.FallbackRestrictionCategories
member.summary:
This collection represents the default restriction categories in case of fallback. Assuming the card has been fall-backed (in case the card that embeddes the categories, could not be read from the primary entry method (i.e. MSR), will be fall-backed to Keyed),
these configured restrictions categories will be used as a default behavior.
These restrictions represent the custom hierarchies which represent the eligible products for the restricted card.

member.remarks: The restriction category will be retrieved by this Id from Custom Categories Configuration.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.SecurityScale.ISecurityScaleParametersProvider.NotAllQtySaleItemsPlacedInBagTimeout
member.summary: This parameter is used only on SCO, when quantity sale is performed and QTY > 1 Parameter triggering point in the flow: qty sale was performed => item is placed on bagging area => weight validation was performed => Result: underweight => New parameter is triggered Parameter is counting the time till one of the below is happening: The time that defined in the parameter is reached Stop counting OR Another item is placed on bagging area. Stop counting and check weight on security scale. If weight validation result is underweight than new parameter is reinitialized

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.SecurityScale.ISecurityScaleData
member.summary: Encapsulates average weight of the product and standard deviation of the product's average weight. This parameters is updated by the ISecurityScaleWeightLearningHandler. While selling a weight product, a check is performed to verify if the product's weight is within the average weight and standard deviation limits. If the weight is not within these limits, the product cannot be sold.

Represents a factory that creates an ISecurityScaleData. the ISecurityScaleData is a structure that Encapsulates average weight of the product and standard deviation of the product's average weight. These parameters are updated by the ISecurityScaleWeightLearningHandler. While selling a weight product, a check is performed to verify if the product's weight is within the average weight and standard deviation limits. If the weight is not within these limits, the product cannot be sold.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.ThirdParty.ThirdPartySession
member.summary: Captures state of the Client Application stored on the RetailTransaction so that the client can recover from a crash. An example of this usage is when the POS Touchpoint calls the EPS in order to get Payment Authorization, it can store the state of the EPS Session on the R10 RetailTransaction, allowing it to recover failure even if a crash happens during the EPS Session.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Selling.IRetailTransaction
member.summary: Represents a single customer session of interaction with the retailer for handling one or more value added transactions. Customer Information is captured during a retail transaction that is shared between value generating transactions. A termination of a retail transaction will usually trigger the reporting and logging of all the involved value generating transactions.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tax.Definitions.ITaxParameters
member.summary: Represents the parameters that specify which data must be collected when a tax exemption is performed in a specific location.

remarks.para: The data required can be mandated for collection by the government by law, or data that the store operator wants to collect and record for informational purposes.

Business unit is a required field for this interface. If this field is set as the root of the Business Unit tree, all the stores in the system will inherit these parameters. These parameters determine which type of data is prompted, and received from the customer. It is possible that all or none of the parameters are set to true.

code.description: This example shows how to retrieve exemption parameters for a specific store in the context of a service

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tax.Definitions.ITaxParameters.BusinessUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the IBusinessUnit to which the tax exemption parameters are relevant
member.remarks: This field is the key for this interface, it cannot be null. The IBusinessUnit can be set to the root of the business unit tree to apply to all stores.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tax.Definitions.ITaxParameters.CustomerExemptionIdRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets the boolean value indicating if the customer has to provide a government issued exemption ID to receive a tax exemption.
member.value: true if customer exemption cannot be executed without a customer ID, otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tax.Definitions.ITaxParameters.ExemptionCustomerNameRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets the boolean value indicating if customer has to provide his/her name to receive a tax exemption.
member.value: true if an exemption ; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tax.Definitions.ITaxParametersDao
member.summary: Represents a data access object for parameters that specify which data must be collected when performing a tax exemption.

code.description: This example shows how to create and use the tax exemption parameters dao.

remarks.para: This data access class handles data for ITaxParameters that are relevant for a specific IBusinessUnit. This data needs to be collected from the customer or entered by the cashier when performing a tax exemption. Some data is mandated by law and some data is collected only for informational purposes. The set of ITaxParameters is relevant if it's defined directly on a specific IBusinessUnit or defined for any of the parents in the business unit hierarchy tree. The data of the closest parent overrides data of any of the other parents higher up in the hierarchy.

members.member:
Gets an instance of ITaxParameters defined for a specific IBusinessUnit only.
This method does not iterate up the business unit hierarchy tree to see if there is a relevant set of ITaxParameters available.
The IBusinessUnit for which the ITaxParameters are defined. The ITaxParameters that are returned if the find request is successful.

Searches the Business Unit hierarchy tree and retrieves an instance of relevant ITaxParameters for the specified IBusinessUnit.
The method finds the relevant ITaxParameters by first checking if they are defined directly for the specified IBusinessUnit. If not found, the algorithm goes up the Business Unit hierarchy through all the parent nodes and looks for the ITaxParameters. The first set that is found is returned, if none are found when the root is reached, false is returned. This means that a parent node closer to the relevant business unit overrides the settings of the parent higher up in the tree. A IBusinessUnit property in ITaxParameters will indicate which node had the parameter definitions.
The IBusinessUnit for which a relevant set of ITaxParameters needs to be found true if relevant ITaxParameters were found, false if not found.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tax.Definitions.ITaxParametersDao.GetAll
member.summary: Retrieves all ITaxParameters regardless of which business unit they were created for.
member.returns: A collection of ITaxParameters or an empty collection of parameters.

members.member:
Add or update ITaxParameters in the system.
parameters to be added or updated.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tax.Definitions.ITaxRate
member.summary: Represents burden ratio at which a business or person is taxed. There are several methods used to present a tax rate like: fixed, percentage, brackets. These rates can also be presented using different definitions applied to a tax : inclusive and exclusive each tax rate have a collection of rule conditions for evaluate this rate for specific context.
Represents the tax rate details as part of the ITaxAuthority entity.

remarks.para: There can be multiple tax rates under a single ITaxAuthority. Each tax rate has a matching rule which determines to which taxable entities it will apply. Example: there can be a single ITaxAuthority for the whole country, but in every store or group of stores a different rate is applied to different item types.

member.summary: Gets an indicator specifying if the tax amount is included or excluded from item price.
member.remarks: An excluded tax is added to the price of the item to get the item's full price and therefore excluded taxes increase the ticket total. Included taxes are already added to the item price and do not add to the ticket total. Included taxes are calculated for tax reporting purposes.

member.summary: Represents method used to calculate the tax. example: percentage Method -the tax is calculated as a percentage of the item price example: Fixed Fee Method the tax is calculated as a fixed amount, and is not dependent on the item price. example: Brackets Method - the tax is calculated as a progressive percentage rates change according to item price.

member.param: The specific order line
member.returns: True if this rate should be calculated for the specific context

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tax.Definitions.ITaxRate.DependenceRates
member.summary: Collection of dependency rates that specific rate dependent on. A dependence rate will be part of the net amount the dependent rate (a.k.a. compound) calculation method applies to. Example: If rate of 10% (exclusive) depends of fixed 1$ rate, the fixed rate will be in the DependenceRates list, and the calculation will be: (Product-Net-Amount + 1$) * 10%.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tax.Definitions.ITaxRate.RoundingMethod
member.summary: Represents method use for rounding the tax value. The rounding is done for 2 decimal places. example: Standard - arithmetical rounding (meaning that if it's less than 0.5 it will be rounded to 0, and equal or larger than 0.5 will be rounded to 1) example: Up always round up example: Down - always round down

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tax.Definitions.ITaxRate.IsCouponReduceTaxationAmount
member.summary: Indicates whether Tax Engine should be called also after coupon is applied and consider its' amount. For example is Yes, then the amount should be reduced and then the Tax should be recalculated based on the new price. otherwise, tax stays the same.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tax.Definitions.ITaxRate.TaxableAmountRoundingStrategyKey
member.summary: Defines the TaxableAmount rounding strategy key that affects the taxable amount prior to tax calculation

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tax.Definitions.ITaxRoundingStrategy
member.summary: This is the strategy that is used to round tax amounts to 2 places after the decimal point. A rounding strategy is mandated by the tax authority. Most common examples include rounding up and arithmetic rounding (meaning that if it's less than 0.5 it will be rounded to 0, and equal or larger than 0.5 will be rounded to 1).

member.summary: Rounds the tax amount to 2 places after the decimal point (i.e. "Up" strategy will always round the amount up)
member.param: The amount to be rounded
member.returns: The amount after rounding (2 places after the decimal point)

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.AuthorizationResponseHeader
member.summary: Response header contains the basic information regarding the response like result code, errors, etc... This header is part of IAuthorization interface.
member.remarks: This component is Serializable due to reason that it is part of the IAuthorization which is persisted into the Data Base.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.AuthorizationResponseHeader.ProviderKey
member.summary: Unique provider key, identifying the provider the authorization request was intended to. Note that actual IEPSProvider doesn't always participate in authorization flow. For example, IPaymentMean might decide to perform local authorization, based on internal logic.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.AuthorizationResponseHeader.ProviderSessionId
member.summary: Unique identification of the performed financial action

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.AuthorizationResponseHeader.AuthorizationType
member.summary: Describes the way that the authorization was performed (Online, Offline, Local etc)
member.remarks:
The electronic payment system's financial operation may be authorized in various ways.
Therefore the authorization may categorized into some types, for example:
Online - Authorization has been approved successfully.
Offline - Authorizer (a.k.a 'External Provider') was not accessible. IAuthorization.IsProviderAccessFailed
Local - Authorization has been approved locally, means that has been approved by the local Electronic Payment System (R10)
without any external provider's involvement.
SmartCard - Authorization has been approved by the smart card terminal device (Pin Pad, GPD, etc).
Offline Forced Acceptance (a.k.a 'OFA') - Authorization was not approved by the authorizer (a.k.a 'External Provider'),
nor the device, but was approved by local Electronic Payment System (R10).
Note these are only default implementations, there may be other Authorization Types.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.AuthorizationResponseHeader.ResultCode
member.summary: Represents the external provider result code.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IEPSProvider
member.summary: Represents an electronic payments processor, and provides electronic payments authorization services.
member.remarks:
IEPSProvider implementations are intended to be used by IPaymentMean as an adapter to EPS authorization systems. Note that this not necessarily will be the case. IPaymentMean could decide, for example, that authorization will be performed locally.
For actions requiring third party authorization, an IEPSProvider implementation is used. The methods below are the last logical step before a request reaches the payment host. They are responsible for interfacing with the payment host. The actual method of communication is controlled by the payment host (bank or financial institution).
A payment mean will use these methods to perform the last step of its own actions, communication to the payment authorizer.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IEPSProvider.Pay(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IAuthorizationRequest)
member.summary: Performs EFT payment.
member.remarks:
Used to make the actual authorization request for payment. The authorization request has to include all parameters (although this is subject to change, according to the specific payment host this is implemented for).
The authorization object must contain all available data to describe the authorized payment.
member.param: payRequest contains payment parameters.
member.returns: An authorization object

members.member:
added in 10.5
Performs payment pre-authorization.
Validates a future payment is possible and reduces the obligo amount. Pre-authorization requires completion to actually make that payment.
Input parameters. An authorization object

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IEPSProvider.Refund(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IAuthorizationRequest)
member.summary: Performs EFT refund
member.param: request contains void parameters
member.returns: An authorization object

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IEPSProvider.TransactionLookup(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IAuthorizationRequest)
member.summary: Lookup all transactions made with this specific payment mean (card).
member.remarks:
Should return a list of all transactions that satisfy the lookup criteria. An empty list means zero transactions were found.
The results supplied by transaction lookup will be later used to perform transaction based returns.
member.param: Data needed to identify the transaction.
member.returns: A collection of lookup result objects

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IEPSProvider.Cashout(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IAuthorizationRequest)
member.summary: Perform EPS cash out
member.remarks: Cashing a gift card out means exchanging whatever balance is left on the card, for cash. This is NOT cash back.
member.param: Data needed to request authorization from payment host.
member.returns: An authorization object

member.summary: Perform an EFT deposit.
member.remarks: Deposit funds into an account, associated with a payment mean (card).
member.param: Data needed to request authorization from payment host.
member.returns: An authorization object

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IEPSProvider.GenerateCustomProviderDataOnly(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IAuthorizationRequest)
member.summary: Note: This method should not perform any actual connection to the host. It could be called to get custom data in cases where no actual connection to the host is required (Local authorization, OFA authorization, SmartCard authorization etc). Returned custom data will be saved as ProviderData on externally created IAuthorization. Null value is supported.
member.returns: Custom provider data to be saved on externally created IAuthorization

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IEPSProvider.ReverseAuthorization(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IAuthorization)
member.summary: Performs reversal of authorized payment (or pre-authorization).
member.remarks: Notifies the payment host that a reversal is required for a pre-authorized payment. Note that in the case of pre-authorization, no payment was ever made; what is being reversed is the pre-authorization of a potential payment.
member.param: Input parameters.
member.returns: An authorization object

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IEPSProvider.CompletePreAuthorization(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IAuthorization,Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Finance.Money.Money)
member.summary: Performs completion of previously authorized payment.
member.remarks: Notifies the payment host that a completion is required for a pre-authorized payment.

The amount that the pre-authorization should be complete for.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMean
member.summary:
Holds the knowledge of performing the actual payment related operations. R10 Services call these methods directly to perform these actions.
When any of them are called, a provider of type IEPSProvider is resolved using the configured provider key. This key is a system parameter named 'EPSProviderKey'.
Requests made to the payment provider are constructed using several input parameters, and potentially extension data.
member.remarks: TODO: add explanation of supported result codes in default implementation: Success, Decline, Offline, VoiceAuthorizationReferral

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMean.InputParameters
member.summary: Holds information acquired about the payment mean in use.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMean.Pay
member.summary: Charge the credit card
member.remarks: Performs the payment using input parameters. Charges the credit card with specified amount Implementors should return IAuthorization object with the data returned from the provider
member.returns: An authorization object

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMean.Refund
member.summary: Refund action on card
member.remarks: Performs the refund using input parameters. Refunds the credit card with specified amount Implementors should return IAuthorization object with the data returned from the provider
member.returns: An authorization object

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMean.TransactionLookup
member.summary: Find all transactions made with this specific payment mean (card).
member.remarks: Performs the lookup using input parameters. This includes card data as the search criteria. Implementors should return IEnumerable of transaction records returned from provider.
member.returns: A collection of lookup result objects

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMean.Cashout
member.summary: Cash out all money in specified credit card.
member.remarks: This is NOT cash back. Cashing a gift card out means exchanging whatever balance is left on the card, for cash. Performs the cashout using input parameters. Cashout is performed using card data Implementors should return IAuthorization object with the data returned from the provider
member.returns: An authorization object

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMean.Deposit
member.summary: EPS Deposit action
member.remarks: Chooses an appropriate deposit executer and performs a deposit to an associated account. The default payment mean implementation validates all parameters with the executer's validator before actually performing the action. It performs the deposit using card data. Implementors should return IAuthorization object with the data returned from the provider
member.returns: An authorization object.

members.member:
changed in 10.5
Preauthorize payment mean
Performs pre-authorization with the requested amount (usually $1 or in the case of fuel purchase, the pump maximum amount). This verifies with the issuer that this card is valid and reduces the obligo amount. The result of this process is used in the completion stage when appropriate. Implementors should return IAuthorization object with the data returned from the provider
An authorization object.

added in 10.5
Cancel previously authorized pre-authorization request.
Uses a previous request's authorization received from the payment provider, to send a reversal request. Implementors should return IAuthorization object with the data returned from the provider
An authorization object.

added in 10.5
Completes previously authorized pre-authorization request.
Uses a previous request's authorization received from the payment provider, to send a completion request. Implementors should return IAuthorization object with the data returned from the provider
The amount that the pre-authorization should be complete for. An authorization object.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMeanIdentity
member.summary: This interface represents a payment mean identity.
member.remarks:
It holds various information regarding the inputted payment mean.
For example: It holds the payment mean's primary account number and its expiration date.
This information will participate in the PaymentMean's financial operation, and will be composed as part of the PaymentMeanInputParameters.
R10 Core supports various types of PaymentMeanIdentities:
CardDataKeyed
CardDataMSR
CardDataScanned
CardDataSmartCard
CardDataToken

code.description: This example shows how to provide a new PaymentMeanIdentity, a.k.a MyPaymentMeanIdentity.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMeanIdentity.ConfigurationGroupId
member.summary: Represents the card identification.
member.remarks:
Represents a set of behaviors for a specific card type.
For example, assuming that the PaymentMeanIdentity is a "VISA" card type, then it should inherit the VISA's behavior and restrictions. Therefore, if the VISA has a restriction that requires signature, then paying with this PaymentMeanIdentity will forced to require a signature from the customer.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMeanIdentity.PrimaryAccountNumber
member.summary: Primary Account Number is the number that identifies a credit card's linked bank account.
member.remarks: Sometimes mistakenly referred to as 'personal account number'. For more information on PANs see PAN on Wikipedia.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMeanIdentity.LoyaltyAccountId
member.summary: The loyalty account number linked to this card.
member.remarks:
The PaymentMeanIdentity may be connected to a loyalty program, therefore such type of PaymentMeanIdentity used to refer as a 'Loyalty Combined',
means it can act either as a financial payment mean and either as a loyalty card. For more information on loyalty program see Loyalty Program on Wikipedia.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMeanIdentity.IsSmartCard
member.summary: Indicates whether the PaymentMeanIdentity is a smart card.
member.remarks:
A smart card, chip card, or integrated circuit card (ICC) is any pocket-sized card with embedded integrated circuits. R10 clients may examine this indicator in order to verify the card's correct entry method.
For example, assuming the customer swiped her credit card and R10 identified this PaymentMeanIdentity as a smart card,
then R10 client may look at it as a mismatch and alert the customer that he should dip this card.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMeanIdentity.ExpirationDate
member.summary: Represents the PaymentMeanIdentity's Expiration Date.
member.remarks: This expiration date holds the combination of the payment mean identity's expiry month and year (e.g: 06/22)

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMeanIdentity.IsManualEntry
member.summary: Indicates whether the primary account number was entered manually.
member.remarks:
If the PaymentMeanIdentity can never be used in manual entry scenarios, this method can return false.
On the other hand, a PaymentMeanIdentity that will be used exclusively for manual entry, can always return true.
member.returns: A Boolean value indicating whether the primary account number manually entered.

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IPaymentMeanIdentity.SupportsOfflineAuthorization
member.summary: Indicates whether offline authorization is supported for this PaymentMeanIdentity.
member.remarks: A good example for a PaymentMeanIdentity that supports offline authorization is Smart cards (ICC), where offline authorization can be provided by the onboard chip even without connectivity.
member.returns: A Boolean value indicating whether offline authorization is supported for this card.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.ExternalTransactionRecord
member.summary: The result of performing EPS transaction lookup
member.remarks: All data is as reported to EPS and save at the provider's end. It is used to return the result of transaction lookup as a list of transaction records, each representing a transaction that matches the lookup criteria. It is then used to build the lookup service response.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.ExternalTransactionRecord.TransactionDate
member.summary: Date and time the original transaction was performed

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.ExternalTransactionRecord.StoreId
member.summary: The store ID in which the transaction was performed

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.ExternalTransactionRecord.TerminalId
member.summary: The terminal ID in which the transaction was performed

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.ExternalTransactionRecord.TotalAmount
member.summary: Amount of the EPS transaction

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.ExternalTransactionRecord.TransactionId
member.summary: Unique transaction ID
member.remarks: Not to be confused with transaction sequence number, this is the external ID (an eight alpha numeric characters string).

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IProviderResultCodeMapping
member.summary: Entity which represents a mapping between a provider result code and an R10 EPS result code.
member.remarks:
External providers provide various result codes that can be translated into business values result codes.
For example, an external provider may return a result code as '02' which may mapped to R10 EPS result code 'Success'.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IProviderResultCodeMapping.ProviderKey
member.summary: Represents the external provider's identifier.
member.remarks: The ProviderKey and the ProviderResultCode combination represents the entity's unique key

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IProviderResultCodeMapping.ProviderResultCode
member.summary: The external provider result code.
member.remarks: The ProviderKey and the ProviderResultCode combination represents the entity's unique key

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IProviderResultCodeMapping.EPSResultCode
member.summary: The R10 EPS result code which mapped to a provider result code.
member.remarks:
A combination of ProviderKey and ProviderResultCode can be translated into this valuable EPS Result code.
For example: Success, Decline, Offline, etc..

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IProviderResultCodeMapping.Message
member.summary: The message associated with the occurrence of the combination between the ProviderKey and the ProviderResultCode.
member.remarks:
This message may be displayed when the result code is received.
For example, assuming the external provider key is 'SOLVE' and its result after making a payment is '02', which may mapped to R10 EPS result code as 'Success'. This combination may be mapped to a message : "Payment succeeded, please take your receipt".

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IProviderResultCodeMapping.IsRejected
member.summary: Indicating whether the external provider's result code represents a declination.
member.returns: The business indication for determine whether the provider rejected the operation.
member.remarks:
The external provider may return a result code as '19' which may be translated into R10 EPS Result as 'Decline'.
This R10 EPS Result Code indicates that the external provider rejected the financial operation.
This indication may be used for additional business flows in R10, for example: Auditing the EPS rejected operations.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IProviderResultCodeMappingDao
member.summary: Represents a data access object for IProviderResultCodeMapping.
member.remarks:
The IProviderResultCodeMappingDao provides the following services:
Saves a ProviderResultCodeMapping entity
Deletes an existing ProviderResultCodeMapping entity
Gets an existing ProviderResultCodeMapping entity by the ProviderKey and the ProviderResultCode
Load all the existing ProviderResultCodeMappings

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IProviderResultCodeMappingDao.Save(Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IProviderResultCodeMapping)
member.summary: Saves a ProviderResultCodeMapping.
member.param: The IProviderResultCodeMapping to save

member.summary: Deletes a ProviderResultCodeMapping
member.param: The IProviderResultCodeMapping to delete

member.name: M:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.IProviderResultCodeMappingDao.Get(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a ProviderResultCodeMapping according to the provider key and the external providerResultCode.
member.param: A string identifying the external payment provider
The external provider's result code.
member.remarks: The combination between the ProviderKey and the ProviderResultCode is unique.
member.returns: A ProviderResultCodeMapping that matches a mapping between the external provider's result code and the EPS result code.

member.summary: Context Input Parameters

member.summary: Request Input Parameters

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.PaymentMeanInputParameters.Card
member.summary: The identified Card Data

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.PaymentMeanInquiryField
member.summary: Represents an additional data regarding the payment mean which required to be filled by the user.
member.remarks:
As part of the financial flow, the user will may required to fill an additional data regarding his payment mean.
It can be any type of data (e.g: AlphaNumeric, Yes/No, DateTime, Numeric, etc).
For example, the user needs to provide the last 4 digits of his VISA card.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.PaymentMeanInquiryField.Name
member.summary: Represents the PaymentMeanInquiryField's name.
member.remarks:
For example, assuming that the user will required to fill his payment mean's 4 last digits as part of the financial flow,
than this PaymentMeanInquiryField's name may be "4LastDigits". This name must be unique.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.PaymentMeanInquiryField.Value
member.summary: Represents the value that was filled by the user.
member.remarks:
This value may be used for any further validation regarding this PaymentMeanInquiryField. For example, assuming the user will required to fill his payment mean's 4 last digits as part of the financial flow,
and he filled this data as "2254", than the PaymentMeanInquiryField's value will be equal to "2254".

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.PaymentMeanInquiryField.Type
member.summary: Represents the type of the value (for example: alpha numeric)
member.remarks:
The queried data needs to be matched with R10 client's contract and with its capabilities. For example, assuming the Point of Sale's user interface may be filled with numeric characters only.
Additionally, the user will required to fill his last name. This example shows a wrong use of PaymentMeanInquiryField, due to the fact that for technically reason the user won't be able to fill the required data.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.PaymentMeanInquiryField.Label
member.summary: Represents the PaymentMeanInquiryField's label upon the R10 client's user interface.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.PaymentMeanInquiryField.Message
member.summary: Represents an additional message to be presented on R10 client's user interface.
member.remarks:
For example, assuming the user will required to fill his payment mean's 4 last digits as part of the financial flow,
and he filled an invalid data (i.e. "123"). As a result, the user will re-queried for this data again with an additional message
which informs him that the input was invalid (i.e: "The number you filled does not contain 4 digits").

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.EPS.PaymentMeanInquiryField.ValidatorKey
member.summary:
Represents a key to (see cref="IPaymentMeanInquiryResponseValidator"/> to perform a validation on received value
when PaymentMeanInquiryField is provided by the user.
member.remarks: The corresponding (see cref="IPaymentMeanInquiryResponseValidator"/> must be registered in the system. and will resolved by this ValidatorKey. Please refer to (see cref="IPaymentMeanInquiryResponseValidator"/> for additional information.

members.member:
Specifies a boolean value indicating if the received tender is allowed for payment or not in the current environment (based on whether a prohibit payment rule exists, and if it applies on the environment).
The tender for which prohibit payment rules are searched. True if the tender is prohibited for payment (a prohibit payment rule exists for it), False if the tender isn't prohibited for payment (no prohibit payment rule exists for it).

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.TenderType.PaymentOptions.IPaymentOptions.AmountEntryOption
member.summary: Gets the value for AmountEntryRequired; this is a location based attribute. The POS will force the user to enter a value in the amount to pay field. "YesWithoutDefault" - Present zero in the input field on the screen and allow the user to enter values. "YesWithDefault"- Present the value of the total transaction and allow the user to perform any changes to the value presented. "YesWithSuggestedAmounts"- Present the suggested amounts value for payment. "No" - Present no window at all and debit the entire transaction amount for the tender.

member.name: T:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.TenderType.IRequiredPaymentParametersValidator
member.summary: Represents the ITenderType's required payment parameters, which are validated. Its main purpose is to support extension validators so that each specific tender (such as ICheque) with specific payment parameters could be configured with its appropriate validators. After associating a tender to such a validation, any tender's authorization action will trigger a validation of those parameters validated.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.TenderType.IRequiredPaymentParametersValidator.MissingParametersName
member.summary: If the validator fails, it should contain the names of empty or null required payment parameters. Otherwise, should be empty or null.

member.name: P:Retalix.StoreServices.Model.Tender.TenderType.IRequiredPaymentParametersValidator.InvalidFormatParameters
member.summary: If the validator fails, it should contain the IDictionary (parameter name, invalid format error message) of the invalid format parameters values. Otherwise, should be empty or null.
